Goel added that Uber is aiming for the service to be mainstream in the next ten years and that Elevate will work in a way similar to UberPOOL.

headlines: Airbnb bans host who canceled woman's booking on being Asian
text: Homestay startup Airbnb has permanently banned a host who canceled a 23-year-old law student's reservation because she was Asian. After the woman threatened to report the case to Airbnb, the host reportedly answered, "Go ahead... This is why we have Trump... We can't have foreigners telling us what to do." Airbnb called the host's behaviour "abhorrent and unacceptable."

headlines: Ola, Uber rivalry like Vietnam War: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal
text: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal on Friday compared the competition between ride-hailing startups Ola and Uber to the Vietnam War. "We are the local guerrillas, we have the Americans carpet bombing us but we will go into the nooks and corners of the country," he added. He also likened Uber's competition with Didi Chuxing in China to World War II.

headlines: Yoga doesn't belong to any particular community: UP Dy CM
text: Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Dinesh Sharma on Friday said people should not try to draw parallels between yoga and religion, while adding that it doesn't belong to any particular community. This comes amid the Yogi Adityanath-led government seeking to make yoga compulsory in the state government-run schools. "This is just an initiative to keep everyone fit," Sharma added.

headlines: Indian man shot dead by robbers in US
text: A 26-year-old Indian man has been shot dead by two armed robbers at a convenience store in Washington state, US, his family said on Friday. The police said Vikram Jaryal, who was working as a clerk, was killed by one of the robbers after he handed them money. He was from Punjab and had recently shifted to the US.

headlines: What is a Tomahawk cruise missile?
text: The Tomahawk cruise missile is a long-range US missile which can be launched from ships and submarines. It can carry warheads weighing up to 454 kg and is designed to fly at low altitudes towards heavily defended targets with extreme accuracy. Tomahawk missiles can be guided by GPS to targets more than 1,600 km away at speeds of 885 km/h.

headlines: Devin Nunes steps down from Russian hacking probe
text: Chairman of US House Intelligence Committee Devin Nunes has stepped down from an inquiry into Russian interference in US presidential elections amid an ethics inquiry. An ethics committee is probing claims that Nunes disclosed classified information. Nunes, who called the charges "entirely false" and "politically motivated", said he would continue to fulfill his other responsibilities as chairman.

headlines: Chinese man following GPS instructions drives into a river
text: A Chinese man reportedly drove his car into a river while following GPS navigation. The driver of the white Hyundai car told the police that he didn't realise that the path he was driving on was leading to water. The police reportedly took about half a day to pull the car out of the water using a truck and bulldozer.

headlines: Larsen & Toubro names SN Subrahmanyan as new CEO
text: Engineering conglomerate Larsen & Toubro (L&T) on Friday named SN Subrahmanyan as its new CEO with effect from July. Further, long-serving head AM Naik will move to a new position of non-executive Chairman. Notably, Naik will assume the new role for a period of three years beginning October 1, immediately upon his retirement as Executive Chairman on September 30.

headlines: OnePlus asked to stop Amitabh Bachchan ad after Sony plea
text: The Delhi High Court has restrained Chinese mobile manufacturer OnePlus from airing its advertisement featuring actor Amitabh Bachchan after a copyright infringement plea by Sony. Sony claimed OnePlus copied their show, Kaun Banega Crorepati's format in the advertisement. The ad, shot in the show's format, has Amitabh Bachchan asking a question related to India's best smartphone to a contestant.

headlines: Sidhu's appearance on Kapil Sharma show challenged in HC
text: A lawyer has approached the Punjab and Haryana High Court seeking a restraining order against Punjab cabinet minister Navjot Singh Sidhu's participation on the television show 'The Kapil Sharma Show'. The PIL filed argues that a public servant can not be allowed to do private business. Sidhu was inducted in the Punjab cabinet on March 16.

headlines: Pic shows Ranveer with Sachin Tendulkar's daughter Sara
text: A picture showing actor Ranveer Singh and former cricketer Sachin Tendulkar's daughter Sara Tendulkar has surfaced online. Earlier, Ranveer was also spotted with Sachin to promote the latter's app. Sachin in 2015 had clarified rumours of his daughter joining films while tweeting, "My daughter Sara is enjoying her academic pursuits. Annoyed at all the baseless speculation about her joining films."

headlines: Ekta Kapoor shares pic with Jeetendra on his 75th birthday
text: Ekta Kapoor shared a picture of herself with father Jeetendra on his 75th birthday on Friday on Instagram. Ekta's mother Shobha Kapoor can also be seen in the picture. "Fathers who build their daughters build a nation! Thanku for being my biggest strength," read the caption alongside the picture. Jeetendra is known for films like 'Himmatwala' and 'Tohfa' among others.

headlines: Asking Deepika for look test wasn't to doubt her: Majidi
text: Iranian director Majid Majidi has said that when he asked actress Deepika Padukone for a look test for his film 'Beyond The Clouds', it was not to doubt her professionalism. "She is an excellent actress. But how much she befits the role, that is in my vision," said Majidi. He added that because of unfavourable circumstances, Deepika couldn't be cast.

headlines: Virat and I are still good friends: David Warner
text: David Warner has said that he remains good friends with Virat Kohli despite a bitterly fought Test series which ended with Kohli saying he was no more friends with some of the Australian cricketers. "I had a chat with Virat. We are still friends, thankfully. I had a text conversation with him which is very nice of him," said Warner.

headlines: Misogyny played a role in election loss: Hillary Clinton
text: Hillary Clinton has said that misogyny had certainly played a role in her presidential election loss. Clinton added that she now spends a lot of time wrestling with the fact that 53% of white women voted for Donald Trump. She also called on politicians on both sides to start acting like patriotic Americans by investigating Russian involvement in the election.

headlines: Air India lifts ban on Shiv Sena MP Ravindra Gaikwad
text: Air India has lifted the ban on Shiv Sena MP Ravindra Gaikwad, accused of assaulting an employee of the airline at Delhi airport last month. The revocation comes after Shiv Sena brought up the issue in Parliament on Thursday, threatening to stall all flights from Mumbai if the ban was not lifted. Air India had earlier repeatedly cancelled Gaikwad's tickets.

headlines: Government allows transgenders to use public toilets
text: The Ministry of Drinking Water and Sanitation has issued guidelines to all states, allowing transgenders to use public toilets of the gender of their choice. The circular, also sent to the Swachh Bharat Gramin Mission, calls for the community's participation in Swachhta drives, and to recruit transgender people to help promote sanitation around the country.

headlines: Double celebrations for Akshay and me: Sonam on N'tnl Award
text: Sonam Kapoor has said that since she's currently shooting with Akshay Kumar, it will be a double celebration for them after their National Award wins. She added, "National Awards are genuine, I'm very kicked about it." Akshay won his first National award after he was named Best Actor for 'Rustom' and 'Airlift', while Sonam got a Special Mention for 'Neerja'.

headlines: Thought it was late April fool's joke: Akshay on N'tnl Award
text: Actor Akshay Kumar has said that when he got to know about his National Award win, he first thought that it was a late April fool's joke. He added, "I've won this award with honesty. I have never cheated or made a call to anyone to win an award." Akshay further said better late than never on his win.nn

headlines: UNESCO award winning film 'Mukti Bhawan' hits the theatres
text: UNESCO award-winning film 'Mukti Bhawan', which released on Friday, "is a brilliant tale of human life and death," wrote Hindustan Times. "The plot is skimpy...(but) the unassuming characters...makes it a delightful watch," said Times of India. NDTV wrote, "This subtly comic and...wise film celebrates life and its complex truths." It was rated 3.5/5 (TOI), 4/5 (HT), 4.5/5 (NDTV).

headlines: US woman accused of murder released on record â¹225 cr bail
text: A US woman accused of murdering the father of her two children is expected to be released from prison on Friday after posting a record bail of $35 million (â¹225 crore). The bail is the highest ever in the history of San Mateo County, an official said. The money was raised by family, friends and business associates with Chinese ties.

headlines: Earbuds that let users control phone with wink or smile made
text: German researchers have developed earbuds that let users perform actions like playing/pausing music, accepting a call or opening a text simply by smiling, winking, opening their mouth or even making a "shh" sound. The earbuds are fitted with electrodes that can detect changes in the electrical fields inside users' ear canal when they make different faces.

headlines: If India is racist, how do we live with South Indians: Vijay
text: Rubbishing allegations of racism in India, BJP leader Tarun Vijay told a TV news channel that if Indians were racist, they wouldnât have been staying with South Indians. "We have blacks, black people around us," he said. "How can we possibly be racist if we worship a black god (Lord Krishan), right?" he added.

headlines: Hindu rashtra not an objective but adjective for India: RSS
text: The RSS on Thursday asserted that the concept of Hindu rashtra (nation) was not an objective but an adjective for this country. "The Hindu Rashtra is a secular, democratic, and an inclusive concept," RSS leader Rakesh Sinha said. Further, he added that the concept of Hindu nation addresses a larger objective, and it was different from any mode of worship.

headlines: Will ensure employees are not assaulted, says Air India
text: An Air India spokesperson on Friday said that the airline will ensure that its employees are not assaulted or misbehaved with. "Will take action to preserve dignity of employees," the spokesperson further added. Notably, Air India has lifted a flying ban on Shiv Sena MP Ravindra Gaikwad nearly two weeks after he assaulted a cabin crew on board a flight.

headlines: Startup turns Porsche 910 into electric car worth â¹6.8 crore
text: Austrian startup Kreisel Electric has reworked a limited-edition Porsche 910 race car and turned it into an electric supercar priced at over â¹6.8 crore. The car has a range of 350 kilometres and accelerates from 0 to 100 kmph in 2.5 seconds. The original Porsche reportedly had maximum power of 162 kilowatt-hours, while the rebooted model operates at 360 kilowatt-hours.

headlines: Toyota recalls over 23,000 Corolla Altis cars in India
text: Japanese automotive manufacturer Toyota is recalling over 23,000 units of its Corolla Altis sedan in India over defective Takata airbags. Corolla Altis units manufactured between January 2010 to December 2012 are included in the recall. The exercise is part of Toyotaâs recall of around 2.9 million vehicles in Japan, China, Oceania and other regions.

headlines: Deadline for account holders to give PAN extended to June 30
text: The Income Tax Department has given banks three more months till June 30 to obtain Permanent Account Number or Form-60 from all account holders. Following demonetisation, the government had issued a notification making it mandatory for savings account holders to provide PAN or Form-60 by February 28. Form-60 is a declaration filed by an individual without a PAN card.

headlines: Girl with habits similar to animals found in Uttar Pradesh
text: A girl with habits similar to animals was found in the Katarniaghat forests of Uttar Pradeshâs Bahraich. The 8-year-old girl was found two months back by cops and she has marks all over her body. An official said she can't understand human language and used to eat off the floor. However, he added she is now showing signs of improvement.

headlines: Air India, IndiGo flights come face to face at Delhi Airport
text: A collision was averted when Air India and IndiGo flights came face to face on the runway at Delhi Airport on Friday. The Air India plane aborted take-off to avoid colliding with the Indigo flight landing on a converging runway. The IndiGo flight reportedly touched down and took off again after seeing the Air India flight at the converging point.

headlines: Mexican state gets its first escalator
text: Tlaxcala, the smallest state in Mexico, has inaugurated its first escalator, a device that was first patented in 1859. While several Mexicans made fun of the state, some called the event "historic." Tlaxcala, a mostly agrarian state which is considered traditional, also got its first lifts in the early 2000s.

headlines: Airtel, Idea shares surge after Jio asked to withdraw offer
text: Shares of telecom operators Bharti Airtel and Idea rose by over 2% in intraday trade on Friday after telecom regulator TRAI ordered Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Jio to withdraw its 3 months complimentary offer. Shares of Reliance Industries however, fell as much as 1.8% during the day. Notably, Jio has said it will comply with the regulator's directions.

headlines: Mallya files appeal against SEBI ban from securities market
text: Vijay Mallya has filed an appeal in the Securities Appellate Tribunal against a SEBI order which barred him from the securities market for alleged violations of listing agreement, diversion of funds and fraud. When the SEBI order was passed, Mallya took to social media to call it a "witch hunt". Notably, SEBI had barred six other officials from United Spirits.

headlines: Actors, MPs to play T20 exhibition match in Dharamsala
text: A team of Bollywood actors will compete against MPs in a T20 cricket match in Dharamsala on Saturday, being held to raise awareness about tuberculosis. Actor Bobby Deol will lead the team of actors, while the MPs team will be captained by former BCCI President Anurag Thakur. Former cricketer Mohammed Azharuddin will also be a part of the MPs team.

headlines: Woman falls off California's tallest bridge, survives
text: A woman, who fell from the tallest bridge in USA's California while taking a selfie and landed 60 feet below on a trail, is expected to survive, the Placer County Sheriff's office said. The woman suffered several fractured bones and requires surgery. She fell from the 730-feet-tall Foresthill Bridge, the highest in California and among the highest in the US.

headlines: MS Dhoni reprimanded for breaching IPL Code of Conduct
text: Former Rising Pune Supergiant captain MS Dhoni has been reprimanded by the match referee for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct's Article 2.1.1 during their match against Mumbai Indians on Thursday. The reprimand is speculated to be caused by Dhoni's mock DRS gesture after an LBW appeal during the game. Article 2.1.1 ensures professional standards of appearance on the field.

headlines: Linesman hit on the face by flying puck in NHL game
text: A linesman was hit on the face by the puck during a National Hockey League game between Minnesota and Colorado in Denver, USA, on Thursday. A player was trying to flick the puck when it hit the referee's face. He stayed down for some time before ultimately going off, with the game continuing with three officials.

headlines: 17 arrested for selling IPL tickets in black
text: At least 17 individuals were arrested in Hyderabad for allegedly selling tickets in black for the Indian Premier League's first match of the season on Wednesday. Raids were conducted at the Rajiv Gandhi International Cricket Stadium by the Special Operation Team. The season's first match was played between Sunrisers Hyderabad and Royal Challengers Bangalore.

headlines: Sehwag takes a dig at Gambhir over remarks on Ishant Sharma
text: Virender Sehwag took a dig at Gautam Gambhir, after the latter questioned Ishant Sharma's IPL base price of â¹2 crore. Gambhir had said the price was too high for someone who would just bowl four overs. Sehwag, mentor of Kings XI Punjab, replied, "Tell me one thing, who pays your â¹12 crore for playing 60 balls then?"

headlines: World Health Day observed by WHO
text: The World Health Organization (WHO) observed World Health Day on Friday, with its year-long campaign "Depression: let's talk". WHO says depression is "often overlooked" and estimates that over 300 million people are living with depression, "the leading cause of ill health and disability worldwide". The global health awareness day is held annually to mark WHO's founding.

headlines: PMO helps man file FIR after he writes to Modi
text: The Prime Minister's Office helped a man file an FIR after he wrote a letter to PM Narendra Modi, addressing him as "raja" and "bhagwan". The man, a Bihar resident, was turned away from three police stations in Delhi and Gurugram after being duped in January. He then wrote to the PMO, following which a case was filed in Gurugram.

headlines: 4 killed in Jammu and Kashmir floods
text: Four people were killed and five others went missing due to incessant rains in Jammu and Kashmir on Friday, even as the authorities declared floods in the valley. A Flood Control Department official said, "all related emergency arrangements have been made," adding that the water level in rivers, lakes and streams is expected to rise further.

headlines: 'Neerja' wins National Award for best Hindi feature film
text: Sonam Kapoor starrer 'Neerja' was named the best Hindi feature film at the 64th National Film Awards announced on Friday. Actress Sonam Kapoor got a special mention for her performance in the film. Directed by Ram Madhvani, 'Neerja' is based on flight attendant Neerja Bhanot's life, who was killed by terrorists while trying to save passengers onboard a hijacked flight.

headlines: Akshay Kumar wins his 1st National Award for Rustom, Airlift
text: Akshay Kumar was named the Best Actor for 'Rustom' and 'Airlift' at the 64th National Film Awards on Friday, marking his first National Award in a career spanning over twenty-five years. Meanwhile, Surabhi Lakshmi won the Best Actress award for Malayalam film, 'Minnaminungu'. Further, actress Zaira Wasim won the National Award for Best Supporting Actor for her role in 'Dangal'.

headlines: Russia responds strongly to US missile attack on Syria
text: Russia said that the US missile strike on its ally Syria amounted to "aggression against a sovereign nation" and is likely to "damage US-Russia relations, which are already in a poor state." The US had fired 59 Tomahawk cruise missiles on a Syrian government airbase said to have been used to launch a chemical attack that killed over 100 civilians.

headlines: Priyanka's debut Marathi production wins 3 National Awards
text: Priyanka Chopra's debut Marathi production 'Ventilator' won in three categories at the 64th National Film Awards announced on Friday. While Rajesh Mapuskar was named Best Director, Rameshwar Bhagat won the Best Editing award. Meanwhile, Alok De bagged the Best Sound Mixing award for the film. 'Ventilator' has been produced by Priyanka and her mother's production banner Purple Pebble Pictures.

headlines: Twitter sues US govt over order to reveal anti-Trump account
text: Social media platform Twitter on Thursday filed a lawsuit against the US government to block an order that required it to reveal who is running an account opposed to US President Donald Trump's immigration policies. The account, @ALT_uscis is claimed to be the work of a government employee. Twitter cited freedom of speech for not turning over the account's records.

headlines: Samsung posts best profit in 3 years despite bribery scandal
text: Samsung Electronics on Friday announced preliminary results for Q1 2017, posting its highest quarterly operating profit in three years at over $8.7 billion. This comes amid an ongoing bribery and embezzlement trial against the group's Chief Jay Y Lee and the company's recovery from the global recall of its exploding Galaxy Note 7 smartphones.

headlines: PM Modi travels in normal traffic to receive Bangladesh PM
text: PM Narendra Modi travelled in normal traffic without any route restrictions to receive Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina at the Delhi airport on Friday. The Bangladesh Prime Minister is visiting India after seven years, with over 20 agreements likely to be signed between the two countries during her four-day visit. The two leaders are scheduled to hold official talks on Sunday.

headlines: India's oldest pending civil case in Rajasthan HC since 1956
text: India's oldest pending civil case has been in the Rajasthan High Court since 1956, Union MoS for Law and Justice PP Chaudhary said on Wednesday. The Allahabad and Jammu and Kashmir High Courts have the oldest pending criminal cases, both filed in 1976. The oldest pending civil and criminal cases in the Supreme Court are from 1982 and 1991 respectively.

headlines: 'Baahubali: The Beginning' re-releases in over 1,000 screens
text: The 2015 epic historical fiction film 'Baahubali: The Beginning' has re-released in over 1,000 screens on Friday. The filmmakers have claimed that this is the widest re-release ever of an Indian film. Notably, the second instalment of the film, 'Baahubali: The Conclusion' is scheduled to release on April 28 in 6500 screens, reportedly the highest ever for any Indian film.

headlines: Got to know from media that I've been arrested, claims Rakhi
text: Rakhi Sawant has claimed that she got to know from the media about her arrest, and added she didn't even know that a case has been filed against her. She added, "If I am guilty, I am ready to go to jail." An arrest warrant was issued against Rakhi for allegedly making "objectionable" remarks against sage Valmiki, who wrote Ramayana.

headlines: Gaikwad poses threat to flight safety: Air India cabin staff
text: The Air India Cabin Crew Association has demanded an unconditional apology from Shiv Sena MP Ravindra Gaikwad for beating up a 60-year-old staffer, stating he poses a risk to flight safety. "Unless he tenders an unconditional apology to AI employeesâ¦we mustn't let him on board," said the association. If he's let off, it would be a crying shame, it added.

headlines: There canât be anything in the name of Babar in India: VHP
text: Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) chief Pravin Togadia on Thursday said there cannot be anything in the name of Babar in India because he was a "foreigner" and an "invader". On the out-of-court settlement in Ram Temple case, Togadia said that during the Chandrashekhar government in 1991, the other party to the dispute had rejected the offer of talks.

headlines: Have to sing Vande Mataram to stay in Uttarakhand: Minister
text: Uttarakhand Minister Dhan Singh Rawat, during a function at a college in Roorkee on Wednesday, said, "If you want to stay in Uttarakhand, you have to sing Vande Mataram". He, however, later clarified that his statement was taken out of context. "I said that there should be Vande Mataram and national anthem in all education institutes," he stated.

headlines: Hindu community is in anger: VHP on Alwar cow vigilante case
text: Reacting to the assault on five men by cow vigilantes in Alwar, VHP leader Surendra Jain has said the Hindu community is angry and the assault was an expression of spontaneous anger. "These people forget the 1857 freedom movement was based on the symbol of cow. Hindus will continue to be furious if their sentiments are hurt," he added.

headlines: Airlines have right to reject passengers: Ex-Aviation Min
text: Following Shiv Sena MP Ravindra Gaikwad assaulting an Air India official, Former Civil Aviation Minister Praful Patel has said airlines have a "right to reject" passengers. "There may not be a law but you see when we go to a hotel, there is board 'admission right reserved'... So the same way airline is no different from a hotel," he said.

headlines: Health startup Practo lays off 150 employees
text: Bangalore-based digital healthcare platform Practo has laid off about 150 employees as part of its annual performance appraisal cycle. Founded in 2008 by Shashank ND and Abhinav Lal, Practo currently has about 1,500-2,000 employees. The startup operates a doctor appointment website and mobile application and offers an ad platform to clinics, hospitals, and diagnostic centres.

headlines: Irish scientists make 1st 2D nanomaterial printed transistor
text: In a first, Dublin-based researchers have fabricated printed transistors consisting of only 2D nanomaterials. Researchers combined graphene nanosheets with conducting materials to make the transistor. The low-cost printed electronics could be applied in food packaging displaying a digital countdown to warn of spoiling, milk cartons sending notifications to phones about expiry, researchers said.

headlines: Scientists expand ability of stem cells to regrow any tissue
text: In a first, scientists have developed a technique to generate both embryonic and non-embryonic tissues from cultured stem cells. Scientists developed a "chemical cocktail" that enables stem cells to develop into tissues that can also support the embryo. Early developmental processes and diseases affecting embryo implantation could be modelled, leading to improved vitro fertilisation techniques.

headlines: UP CM Adityanath drops 'Samajwadi' name from govt schemes
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has decided to drop the word 'Samajwadi' from all government schemes and replace it with 'Mukhyamantri'. The former SP regime had implemented a number of projects with the word 'Samajwadi', including pension and smartphone schemes. Last week, the word 'Samajwadi' was dropped from the state's ambulance service, after a directive by the State Health Minister.

headlines: Air India flyers protest as flight delayed by over 24 hours
text: Over 300 passengers of a Kochi-Jeddah Air India flight staged a protest on Thursday after their flight was delayed by over 24 hours. It was scheduled to depart the previous evening but passengers were asked to deplane for the second day on Thursday. Air India said the flight, which departed later that day, was delayed due to a technical glitch. n

headlines: Air India cancels Shiv Sena MP Gaikwad's ticket for 7th time
text: Air India has cancelled Shiv Sena MP Ravindra Gaikwad's ticket for the seventh time. The Air India Cabin Crew Association called Gaikwad "a risk to flight safety," asserting that his flying ban shouldn't be lifted unless he tenders an "unconditional apology" to Air India staff. Meanwhile, Gaikwad earlier said he apologised to the Parliament but not the Air India employee.

headlines: Airtel fires Head of Alliance for code of conduct violation
text: Bharti Airtel has terminated the services of its vice-president and head of alliances Pallab Mitra for alleged code of conduct violation. Airtel learnt about the code of conduct violation from a whistleblower after which it conducted a probe into the matter. âThe company's code of conduct...follows a policy of zero tolerance in the event of any violation," Airtel stated.

headlines: Jio's complimentary offer not in sync with regulations: TRAI
text: TRAI Chairman RS Sharma has said the telecom regulator advised Reliance Jio to stop its complimentary services offer as it wasn't in accordance with the regulatory framework. TRAI has asked Jio to withdraw its three-month complimentary offer of unlimited data usage and free calls on payment of a minimum â¹303. Jio has said it will fully comply with TRAI's order.

headlines: Brain samples on display on World Health Day
text: Around 20 brain samples of people who died due to neurological disorders went on display in Delhi on Friday during a workshop being organised by the Health Ministry to mark World Health Day. An official said the workshop aims to spread awareness of various neurological disorders, including depression. The theme for World Health Day this year is 'Depression: Let's Talk'.

headlines: Gujarat Lions' McCullum, Faulkner troll each other
text: New Zealand's former captain Brendon McCullum and Australia's James Faulkner, who both play for the Gujarat Lions, trolled each other on Twitter. Faulkner tweeted about how he was reminding McCullum of the time he dislodged his off stump during an Australia-New Zealand ODI. McCullum replied with a tweet that read, "I don't remember playing against you!!!???".

headlines: Misbah responds to Pak's decline with Punjabi philosophy
text: Pakistani captain Misbah-ul-Haq, who announced his retirement recently, responded with a philosophical statement in Punjabi to a journalist's question about Pakistan going from the top-ranked Test team to registering five defeats in a row. "If a man who has lived for 70 years can suddenly die one day, what's a team falling in the rankings in three months", replied Misbah.

headlines: NASA study proves, reshapes 50-year-old plasma wave theory
text: A NASA atmospheric study provided observational proof of a 50-year-old plasma wave theory where certain waves act as energy transporters in plasma, composed of charged particles commonly called the fourth state of matter. The study validated the energy transfer ability of the particle-trapping 'kinetic AlfvÃ©n wave', revealing small-scale complexities reshaping the understanding of plasma physics.

headlines: Two soldiers succumb to injuries in J&K avalanche
text: Out of the five soldiers trapped in multiple avalanches in Jammu and Kashmir's Batalik sector, two succumbed to their injuries on Friday while one is still missing. Two of the five soldiers were rescued earlier. As per the Army, the unprecedented snowfall in the Valley had triggered multiple avalanches and a post in the Batalik sector was buried under snow.

headlines: US launches missile strike against Syrian chemical attack
text: The US has ordered a targeted missile attack against a Syrian airfield suspected of launching a chemical attack. Two US warships fired dozens of missiles from the eastern Mediterranean Sea against the airbase controlled by Assad's forces, officials said. The US said the attack was in the "national security interest," adding, "previous attempts at changing Assad's behaviour have all failed".

headlines: Uruguay to sell recreational marijuana in pharmacies
text: Uruguay will become the first country in the world to allow pharmacies to sell recreational marijuana, starting July. The cannabis will be grown by licensed producers, and government on Friday said it hopes the formalisation process will "guarantee the quality and the purity of the product" citizens consume. Uruguay began the process of legalising recreational cannabis consumption in late 2013.

headlines: Jackie Chan has world record for most stunts by living actor
text: Hong Kong actor Jackie Chan has the Guinness record for the most number of stunts by a living actor. The actor, who turned 63 on Friday, has made over 200 films and is known for movies including 'Police Story', 'Drunken Master' and the 'Rush Hour' series. Chan's injuries have included breaking both his cheekbones, skull and his nose three times.

headlines: If needed, I'll donate my organs to Vinod Khanna: Irrfan
text: Irrfan Khan has said that if needed, he will donate one of his organs to veteran actor Vinod Khanna. "I saw his photo today and I was shocked. I pray to God for his good health," said Irrfan while talking about a photo showing Vinod in a hospital gown which emerged online. The veteran actor is reportedly suffering from cancer.

headlines: I was thrown out of films, called a liar: Raveena
text: Actress Raveena Tandon has revealed that she has been thrown out of films, called a liar and treated badly in the film industry. She said this was because it is challenging and hard to survive in the entertainment industry if one is honest. Raveena added, "However, I stuck to being honest and treated people with respect."

headlines: Photographers pushed me aside once to click Aamir: Vidya
text: Actress Vidya Balan has revealed that in her early days in Bollywood, photographers pushed her aside once to click actor Aamir Khan, which hurt her ego. She added, "When I reached home... I realised he has done a lot many good films...and is a well-known star. The moment I realised this, I was perfectly normal."

headlines: PM Narendra Modi to reshuffle Cabinet: Report
text: As per a report, PM Narendra Modi will reshuffle his Cabinet after the ongoing Parliament session. The report further states that External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj might be replaced by Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje and BJP MP Om Prakash Mathur may take over as Rajasthan CM. Notably, both Finance and Defence Ministries are at present being held by Arun Jaitley.

headlines: BJP praises SDMC by posting pic of street lights in Canada
text: BJP's official Twitter handle on Thursday made a gaffe by tweeting a picture of street lights in Canada's Shelburne district while praising the South Delhi Municipal Corporation for replacing  two lakh sodium street lights with LED lights. The party further claimed that such an action by the SDMC would save 6 crore units of electricity every year.

headlines: Hand over Samajwadi Party back to Mulayam: Aparna Yadav
text: Samajwadi Party's Founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's younger daughter-in-law has appealed the party President Akhilesh Yadav to hand over the control of the party back to his father. "Bhaiya (Akhilesh) promised that after the Assembly elections he will hand back the post of SP National President to Netaji. I expect him to live up to his words," she added.

headlines: Hot steamy atmosphere detected on Earth-like 'water world'
text: UK-based astronomers have found evidence for an "atmosphere of hot steam" around an Earth-like planet that circles a red dwarf star. The planet GJ 1132b, lies 39 light-years away in the Vela constellation. The exoplanet has surface temperatures around 250ÂºC, and so, may not be habitable, however, it is a possible "water world" with a hot steamy atmosphere, astronomers said.

headlines: Early human cannibalism a ritual than just hunger: Study
text: Cannibalism among early humans was more likely related to social reasons than just satisfying hunger, research suggests. Further, evidence of man-eating behaviour at various sites suggested the existence of ritualistic behaviour. Arguing that human meat is much less nutritional than animals', scientists said that cannibalism could be more of a ritual than being exclusively about survival.

headlines: First-ever leaf vein-like design extends battery life: Study
text: In a first, researchers have designed a porous material mimicking leaf vein structures that could make energy transfers more efficient. The synthetic material showed enhanced performance in photocatalysis, gas sensing, and lithium ion batteries. The material could improve battery performance by optimising charge and discharge processes which, at the moment, limit their lifespan, researchers said.

headlines: Hindus to witness 3.3 crore fewer births in 2055-60: Pew
text: As per a new study by Pew Research Centre, Hindus will witness 3.3 crore fewer births in 2055-60 in comparison with 2010-2015 period due to declining fertility in India. The study further claimed that by 2060, when the global population is expected to be 960 crore, Muslims would have grown by 70% and Christians would grow by 34%.

headlines: 5 soldiers trapped in avalanches in J&K's Batalik, 2 rescued
text: Five soldiers were trapped at an army post on Thursday as snowfall triggered multiple avalanches in Jammu and Kashmir's Batalik sector. Two soldiers were later rescued and specially trained Avalanche Rescue Teams have been deployed to rescue the other three, an Indian Army spokesperson said. Twenty army personnel were martyred in January in Kashmir because of avalanches.

headlines: 10% surcharge on stamp duty for cow protection in Rajasthan
text: The BJP-led Rajasthan government has imposed 10% surcharge on stamp duty for the conservation and propagation of cows in the state. The surcharge will be applicable on non-judicial instruments and will have a bearing on costs of making documents like property sale or lease deeds, rent agreements, mortgage etc.

headlines: SC notice to 6 states on plea seeking ban on cow vigilantes
text: The Supreme Court on Friday gave three-week time to the Centre and six states governments to respond to a petition seeking a ban on cow protection groups. The court issued the notice to UP, MP, Gujarat, Jharkhand, Karnataka and Rajasthan governments. The petition was moved by Congress leader Tehseen Poonawalla. Recently, five men were assaulted by cow vigilantes in Alwar.

headlines: UK to release first ever foreign owners' property register
text: Foreign citizens and companies who own property in London and UK will be listed in a public register to help investigators track down and recover proceeds of crime, according to reports. It will be world's first public register of owners of foreign companies which own property in the country. Notably, Indians are among the largest overseas buyers of UK property.

headlines: ISIS-linked hackers release 8,000-name kill list for US, UK
text: United Cyber Caliphate (UCC), a hacking group that supports Islamic State, has released a 'kill list' with names of 8,786 people primarily from the US and UK. It also left a threat for US President Donald Trump, which read "[Y]our counter attacks only make us stronger. The UCC will start a new step in this war against you".

headlines: Store starts potato peeling classes for stressed shoppers
text: Selfridges, a high-end department store in London, has started potato peeling classes to help stressed consumers "reconnect" with themselves. A consumer said it was "a very meditative experience," while another added, "It reminded me of happy family times." The workshop forms part of Selfridges' new Our House project, which is also planning classes on grinding spices and tying herb bundles.

headlines: Dhoni signals for DRS to mock umpire's wrong LBW decision
text: Rising Pune Supergiant wicketkeeper MS Dhoni signalled for a review to mock the umpire's wrong LBW decision during the IPL match against Mumbai Indians on Thursday. Pune bowler Imran Tahir trapped MI's Kieron Pollard LBW, but the umpire ruled not out. Replays showed the batsman was out, with Dhoni making the DRS signal to protest the decision.

headlines: Aussie bowler O'Keefe fined â¹10 lakh for drunken comments
text: Australian spinner Steve O'Keefe has been fined Australian $20,000 and banned from a domestic tournament next year for making drunken comments at an official function last week. O'Keefe, who will now undergo counselling, accepted the sanction and offered an "unconditional apology" for his behaviour. In August 2016, the bowler was fined AUD $10,000 for offensive behaviour also related to drinking.

headlines: Regret not leading Pakistan against India, says Misbah
text: Pakistan's Test captain Misbah-ul-Haq, who will retire from international cricket at the end of the West Indies tour, says he regrets not leading the team against India. "It's not in our hands but yes it is my regret...specially when our Test side was doing so well," said Misbah. He played the last Test held between the two countries in 2007.

headlines: Every dog has his day, Vivian Richards tells BCCI
text: Former West Indies cricketer Sir Vivian Richards has spoken against BCCI campaigning to retain its majority revenue share in ICC, saying "every dog has his day". "We as West Indies during our hay day made a lot of teams make money by going for tours...it should be equal because everyone is making a contribution to the international stage," said Richards.

headlines: Scientists test frictional limits of metals in vacuum
text: US-based researchers used computer simulation and an ultrahigh vacuum tribometer used in friction testing to predict the limits of frictional endurance in metals. Friction between metals in contact cause wear and tear, leading to a loss in the performance of devices. The model could change designs of electrical metal contacts, affecting automobile and wind turbine industries, said the researchers.

headlines: Smoke forces flight to make emergency landing in Kolkata
text: A UAE-bound Air Arabia flight from Bangladesh was forced to make an emergency landing at the Kolkata Airport on Thursday after smoke was reported in the cockpit. The flight, carrying 164 passengers and 17 crew members, took off for Sharjah after nearly four hours. Meanwhile, Air Arabia said that all passengers and crew members were safe.

headlines: US flags fly at half-mast in honour of astronaut John Glenn
text: Flags across the United States were flown at half-mast on Thursday in honour of John Glenn, who was the first American to orbit the planet in 1962. President Donald Trump had issued a proclamation ordering the lowering of the flags "as a mark of respect" in the astronaut's memory. Glenn, who died in December, was buried on Thursday.

headlines: OPS camp campaigns with replica of Jaya's mortal remains
text: AIADMK's breakaway faction led by former Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam (OPS) has been spotted campaigning for the by-elections with a replica of late CM Jayalalithaa's mortal remains. DMK's Radha Ravi slammed this move and said that a man like Panneerselvam should not approach people in such an unethical way. By-elections to RK Nagar seat are due on April 12.

headlines: Terrorists, rapists allowed to fly but not Gaikwad: Sena MP
text: While slamming major airlines for banning Shiv Sena MP Ravindra Gaikwad from flying, party's MP Sanjay Raut on Thursday said terrorists, Pakistani artists, rapists are allowed to fly but not Gaikwad. "One airline owner has nexus with Dawood Ibrahim. An airline allowed Vijay Mallya to flee," Raut added. Raut also said Sena might boycott NDA's April 10 meeting over this.

headlines: Won't attend NDA meet if ban on Gaikwad not revoked: Sena
text: Shiv Sena has threatened to not attend the April 10 NDA meeting if the flying ban imposed by domestic airlines on its MP Ravindra Gaikwad is not revoked. There has been a conspiracy and the party would expose it at an appropriate time, Sena MP Sanjay Raut said. This is an instruction from party chief Uddhav Thackeray, he added.

headlines: Kerala HC slams news channels for acting irresponsibly
text: The Kerala High Court has slammed Malayalam news channels for crossing "all the limits of propriety, gentility and professional etiquettes," in discussions over the removal of Kerala Vigilance chief Jacob Thomas. The court said in its ruling that it was wrongly and irresponsibly telecasted that it had directed the government to change the (Vigilance) Director.

headlines: Delhi govt gave houses to ministers as office space: Panel
text: The Shunglu Committee, set up by former Delhi Lt Governor Najeeb Jung, has found irregularities in land allotments by the Arvind Kejriwal-led government. The committee alleged that residential houses were allotted to ministers under the guise of office accommodation. Further, it said Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal was provided accommodation despite not being entitled to one.

headlines: Schools reduced to just come, eat, and go: HRD Minister
text: Many schools in India have become just mid-day meal schools, and the students are not detained in a particular class, HRD Minister Prakash Javadekar has said. "These schools were reduced to coming, eating and going," Javadekar added. Further, he said that it was a serious problem that a class VI child was unable to read a class II lesson.

headlines: Minor among 3 Muslims arrested in Assam for displaying beef
text: As many as three Muslim construction workers, including a minor, were arrested in Assam's Jorhat district for allegedly hurting religious sentiments by displaying beef, police said on Thursday. A local court has sent two of the accused to 14 days' judicial custody. "They bought beef from somewhere...went to a vegetable market where they talked about their purchase," police added.

headlines: Kerala shuts down over police action on dead student's kin
text: Kerala witnessed a state-wide shutdown on Thursday after policemen manhandled and forcibly dragged away protesting family members of Jishnu Pranoy, a Nehru College student who was found dead in his hostel. The student's mother was hospitalised after sustaining injuries during the police action that was aimed at disrupting their peaceful protest over delay in the probe into Jishnu's death.

headlines: 17 US states challenge Trump over climate change policy
text: A coalition of 17 US states filed a legal challenge on Wednesday against efforts by President Donald Trump's administration to roll back climate change regulations. The coalition said the administration has a legal duty to regulate emissions of the gases that scientists believe cause global climate change. Trump had signed an executive order last month reversing Obama-era climate regulations.

headlines: Vladimir Putin's gay clown meme banned in Russia
text: Russia has banned images that depict President Vladimir Putin as a gay clown, claiming the photos represent "extremism". The meme emerged in 2013 after Russia began its crackdown on the LGBTQ community and banned sharing "nontraditional sexual relations propaganda" with children. Russian spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said that Putin is skilled at brushing off "vulgarities" hurled against him.

headlines: Turkish probe confirms Assad used chemical weapons in Syria
text: Turkish Justice Minister Bekir Bozdag on Thursday said that autopsies of three Syrians killed in the recent chemical attack in Syria's Idlib confirmed that chemical weapons had been used by Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's regime. Around 32 injured Syrians had been brought to Turkey for medical treatment after the attack killed over 100 and injured around 400.

headlines: UN SC calls for probe into Syria chemical attack
text: In the UN Security Council's emergency meeting over the Syrian chemical attack, Britain, France, and the United States presented a draft resolution accusing the Syrian government of the attack and demanded a full investigation into it. However, Russia defended its ally and said the text of the draft was "categorically unacceptable".

headlines: Thai King signs military-backed constitution
text: Thailand's King Maha Vajiralongkorn on Thursday signed a new military-backed constitution that strengthens the army's grip over the government and puts the country on the path to polls in 2018, four years after the military seized control. "This constitution aims to fully rid the country of corruption, abuses of power and prevent corrupt politicians from taking office," the charter read.

headlines: South Africa lifts ban on domestic rhino horn sales
text: South Africa's Constitutional Court has dismissed an appeal by the Department of Environmental Affairs to keep a ban on domestic trade in rhino horn. The moratorium, which had been in effect since 2009, was rejected last year by a lower court. Notably, South Africa is home to about 20,000 rhinos, more than 80% of the world's total population.

headlines: Never knew I was born for music, mother predicted it: Rahman
text: Musician AR Rahman has said that he never knew that he was born for music and it was his mother who made the choice as she predicted he would become a music composer. Talking about his Academy Award wins, Rahman added, "It took 81 years for an Asian to win an Oscar in sound. For me, it took fourteen years."

headlines: Twitter reacts to Gordon Ramsay insulting Sambar-Vada
text: Reacting to Gordon Ramsay's tweet which compared Sambar-Vada to prison food, a user tweeted, "Every cuisine that you're ignorant about is not from prison!" Other users reacted with tweets like, "The food looks normal plate of Vada, Sambar and chutney. Unless you mean normal Indian food is only good for prison."

headlines: Pandya hits 5 boundaries in Dinda's 20th over
text: Mumbai Indians all-rounder Hardik Pandya hit Rising Pune Supergiant's Ashok Dinda for four sixes and one four in the final over of the innings. Pandya hit the first three balls for sixes before hitting a four and a six respectively on the next two balls, helping MI end the innings at 184/8. Pandya remained unbeaten on 35(15).

headlines: Pune's MS Dhoni trolls Kevin Pietersen over on-field mic
text: Rising Pune Supergiant's MS Dhoni trolled commentator Kevin Pietersen over the on-field microphone during their encounter against Mumbai Indians on Thursday. Pietersen asked Pune's Manoj Tiwary to tell Dhoni that he is better at golf than him, to which Dhoni replied, "He (Pietersen) is still my first Test wicket." Pietersen later said it was a referral rather than Dhoni's wicket.

headlines: Smith's unbeaten 84 helps Pune register their 1st IPL win
text: Rising Pune Supergiant's captain Steve Smith scored an unbeaten 54-ball 84 to help the team chase 185 in their IPL encounter against Mumbai Indians on Thursday. Mumbai put on a total of 184/8, with Nitish Rana, Hardik Pandya and Jos Buttler scoring 30s. Mumbai Indians' Kieron Pollard failed to defend 13 runs in the match's final over.

headlines: Canonical ends development of Ubuntu-powered phones
text: Canonical, the creator of Linux-based operating system Ubuntu has announced that it is ending all its mobile projects. The company said it will end investment in 'Unity8', an interface for desktops, phones, and tablets which allowed Ubuntu-powered mobile devices to act as computers when docked. Canonical will also switch the default Ubuntu desktop back to its old interface called 'GNOME'.

headlines: Eminent educationist found hanging at home in Odisha
text: Eminent educationist and Professor Janki Ballabh Padhee was on Thursday found hanging at his residence in Bhubaneswar, Odisha. Padhee had started a coaching institute for IIT and medical entrance examinations, and had also started a private science college by investing more than â¹100 crore. As per reports, he allegedly committed suicide as he was being mentally harassed by some people.

headlines: Student gets notice for cooking beef inside Kerala college
text: A college in Kerala's Kozhikode has issued a memo to a student who allegedly cooked beef inside the campus. The student reportedly brought beef during a symbolic protest which was organised by CPI(M)'s student wing SFI against the closure of college canteen on March 20. Other students had cooked rice, fish curry, chicken, and distributed it on campus.

headlines: 500 kg cocaine worth â¹123 crore seized in Spain
text: Spanish police have seized 500 kg of cocaine hidden inside fire-resistant bricks as part of a two-year investigation into an international drug smuggling operation run by a person identified as 'The Grandmother'. The estimated value of the cocaine is â¬18 million (over â¹123 crore). The police also seized â¬200,000 (over â¹1 crore), 28 buildings and 20 vehicles in the raids.

headlines: Pak poll body bans social media, YouTube in its offices
text: The Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) has issued a notification banning the use of social media websites, including Facebook and Twitter, and YouTube in its offices across the country. "Blocking social media and video streaming sites on ECP networks will minimise malware attacks and ensure the discipline of using electronic resources up to the optimum level," officials said.

headlines: Dog saves wedding party from suicide bomber in Nigeria
text: A dog reportedly stopped a suicide bomber from killing guests at a wedding party in Nigeria by grappling with her until her explosives detonated. The bomber, believed to be from Boko Haram, was making her way into the party when the dog attacked her. No guests were injured but the dog was killed by the explosion alongside the bomber.

headlines: Schwarzenegger accuses Trump of 'robbing children blind'
text: Actor Arnold Schwarzenegger accused US President Donald Trump of "robbing children blind" while criticising his proposed $1.2-billion cut to after-school programs. "President Trump promised us he wants to 'make America great again'. That's not how you make America great," Schwarzenegger said. "We're going to go to Washington, and we're not going to take this lying down," Schwarzenegger added.

headlines: Martin Luther King's daughter reacts to Kendall's Pepsi ad
text: Civil rights activist Martin Luther King's daughter Bernice King reacted to model Kendall Jenner's Pepsi advertisement while tweeting, "If only Daddy would have known about the power of #Pepsi." Bernice also shared an image of her father being held back by police. The Pepsi ad showed Kendall giving a beverage can as a peace offering to police during a protest.

headlines: Malinga equals most hat-tricks record in int'l cricket
text: Sri Lankan fast bowler Lasith Malinga on Thursday claimed his fourth hat-trick in international cricket, achieving the feat in the second T20I against Bangladesh in Colombo. With this, Malinga has equalled the record of former Pakistani pacer Wasim Akram for most hat-tricks in international cricket. It was Malinga's first hat-trick in T20Is while the other three were in ODIs.

headlines: Maharashtra Assembly passes bill to allow bullock cart races
text: The Maharashtra Assembly on Thursday passed a bill to amend the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act to legalise bullock cart races in the state. The amendment is aimed at ensuring the preservation of native breeds of bulls, reports said. Earlier, Tamil Nadu had passed a similar bill to overturn a Supreme Court-ordered ban on the bull-taming sport of Jallikattu.

headlines: Reliance Jio ordered to withdraw 15-day Prime plan extension
text: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) on Thursday ordered Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Jio to withdraw the 15-day extension for subscribing to its Jio Prime service. Further, the regulator has asked Jio to withdraw the 3-month complimentary benefits of its Jio Summer Surprise offer. In response, the company has said it will fully comply with the regulator's direction.

headlines: Samsung to pay Huawei â¹75 crore after losing patent case
text: A Chinese court has ordered Samsung Electronics' mainland subsidiaries to pay â¹75 crore to technology company Huawei Technologies for patent infringement. Huawei had reportedly sought compensation for over 3 crore Samsung products that sold for â¹82,000 crore which infringed its patents, including Galaxy S7. The two companies are also engaged in legal battles over different patents in other courts.

headlines: There's nothing wrong with Hindu Rashtra concept: Adityanath
text: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister in an interview to Doordarshan said, "There's nothing wrong with the concept if that serves the interests of the people and country." He further said, "The Supreme Court has defined Hinduism as a way of life. It helps our people bring in peace. If Hindu Rashtra improves our life, there is no problem in accepting it."

headlines: Why do we say 'cheese' before taking photos?
text: According to a theory, we say 'cheese' before taking photos as saying the word causes a person to smile. During Victorian era, people avoided smiling in photographs by saying 'prunes', as only children and working class people usually smiled. However, when Kodak launched a camera in the 1900s, photography was made more accessible and was paired with smile-ad campaigns.

headlines: Trailer of Irrfan, Pak actress Saba's Hindi Medium released
text: The trailer of Irrfan Khan and Saba Qamar's upcoming film 'Hindi Medium' has been released. It will mark the Bollywood debut of Pakistani actress Saba Qamar. The film is about a couple, played by Khan and Qamar, who are trying to get their daughter admitted to an English-medium school. Directed by Saket Chaudhary, the film will release on May 12.

headlines: Israeli party delays elections over Britney Spears concert
text: Israel's Labour party has postponed its elections from July 3 to July 4 to avoid a clash with a concert by US singer Britney Spears in Tel Aviv. The decision would make it easier for people to reach polling stations as they are likely to be at sites close to the concert venue, the party's spokesperson said.

headlines: Poster of Sidharth Malhotra, Manoj Bajpayee's 'Aiyaary' out
text: The first poster of the Sidharth Malhotra and Manoj Bajpayee starrer 'Aiyaary' has been released. The film is reportedly a crime thriller, based on the 1987 Opera House heist which involved a group posing as CBI officers for a fake income tax investigation raid. Directed by Neeraj Pandey, 'Aiyaary' is scheduled to release on January 26, 2018.

headlines: Kher shares email ID urging depressed people to write to him
text: Anupam Kher shared his email ID while tweeting, "Please write to me at anupam@anupamkhercompany.com if someone you know is feeling low, lonely or depressed. Will be happy to talk to them." He tweeted this after talking about Mumbai engineering student's suicide, which he said was a reminder that it's common for young people these days to feel lonely and depressed.

headlines: Sena questions AI CMD's 'aukat', accuses him of insulting MP
text: Reacting to the Ravindra Gaikwad-Air India controversy, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has said, "CMD ki kya aukat hai ki social media par ek saansad ka apmaan kar rahe ho?" Raut further said, "It is clearly visible in the clips that the MP was ill-treated. You're teaching us how to behave properly, first you learn how to do it yourself."

headlines: Uber sued after co-passenger slashes woman's face with knife
text: A Chicago woman has sued ride-hailing startup Uber after a fellow passenger allegedly slashed her face with a knife when the two shared an UberPOOL ride. Accusing Uber of being negligent, the complainant has sought over â¹97 lakh from the startup and her attacker. However, Uber's insurance provider has denied compensation to the victim as attack was not considered 'accidental'.

headlines: IIT-Kharagpur may get first batch of MBBS students by 2020
text: IIT-Kharagpur can induct the first batch of MBBS students in its medical college by 2020-21, the institute's Deputy Director Professor Sriman Kumar Bhattacharyya has said. The first phase of construction of the engineering institute's medical college will be done by June and the hospital will be operational from 2018. The Centre has sanctioned â¹150 crore to IIT-Kharagpur for the hospital.

headlines: Advani, Joshi agree to face charges in Babri mosque case
text: Veteran BJP leaders LK Advani and Murli Manohar Joshi on Thursday agreed to face conspiracy charges in the Babri mosque demolition case if the CBI can produce evidence against them in Raebareli. Earlier, CBI pleaded the Supreme Court to revive the charges against the leaders. Several BJP leaders remain accused of instigating crowds that demolished the Babri mosque in 1992.

headlines: Kerala launches free legal aid in triple talaq cases
text: Amid the debate on the constitutional validity of triple talaq, Kerala government has announced free legal aid to women divorced under the practice. Panels comprising of four women advocates each in all of the 14 districts of the state have been formed for the purpose. Aggrieved women can approach the panels to seek appropriate legal assistance.

headlines: CBI probing fake Beti Bachao scheme forms: Govt
text: Minister of State for Women and Child Development Krishna Raj on Thursday said that the CBI is probing the matter of alleged fake forms for 'Beti Bachao, Beti Padhao' (BBBP) scheme. As per the complaints received by the government, the fake forms made false promises regarding cash incentive of â¹2 lakh between the age of 8 to 32 years.

headlines: Syria accuses Turkey of moving border fences to grab land
text: Syria's ambassador to Russia Riad Haddad has accused Turkey of unilaterally moving a border fence deeper into Syrian territory in an alleged "land grab" violating the country's sovereignty. This comes after Turkish troops crossed into Syria as a part of Operation Euphrates Shield in 2016 to suppress Syrian Kurdish insurgency. They now control 2,000 square km in northern Syria.

headlines: Aung Suu Kyi denies ethnic cleansing of Rohingyas in Myanmar
text: Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi has denied that ethnic cleansing is happening in the country's Muslim-majority Rakhine region and said, "it is a matter of people on different sides of the divide." This comes after over 75,000 Rohingyas fled to Bangladesh to escape the government's crackdown in which soldiers have been accused of raping and killing dozens of civilians.

headlines: Oil firm BP cuts CEO pay by â¹48 crore on shareholder revolts
text: Oil giant BP has cut CEO Bob Dudley's 2016 pay package by 40% (â¹48 crore) to $11.6 million (â¹75 crore) following shareholder revolts. The oil company has introduced changes from this year that will lower executives' performance incentives. Notably, executive pay has come under scrutiny in the UK following corporate scandals like the collapse of store chain BHS.

headlines: Jio free services will impact other telcos' earnings: Report
text: Free services offered by Reliance Jio will hurt the earnings of other telecom operators for the March quarter, according to ICICI Securities' report. Further, mobile revenues are likely to drop by 6.5-7.5%, for the period under review, the report said. Notably, Jio has extended free services for its Prime members till June.

headlines: Gadkari saying I chased Padma Bhushan hurtful: Asha Parekh
text: Actress Asha Parekh on Thursday said Union Minister Nitin Gadkari's claim that she "chased" him for the Padma Bhushan was "hurtful". "It was not the right thing for him to do...It didn't matter to me...Controversies are a part of the film industry," she added. Parekh told me she was entitled to the award for her contributions, Gadkari had claimed.

headlines: Kapil demands 50% fee hike from channel for his show: Report
text: As per reports, Kapil Sharma has asked for a 50 percent fee hike from the channel for his show, after his contract is renewed. Recently, it was reported that the channel has given a month-long extension to Kapil to improve the show's TRPs. Meanwhile, Chandan Prabhakar and Ali Asgar haven't shot for the show after Sunil's brawl with Kapil.n

headlines: Sunny Deol's dance is better, tweets user on Amy's IPL dance
text: Reacting to Amy Jackson's performance at IPL 2017 opening, a user tweeted, "IPL could have hired Sunny Deol atleast his dance is better than Amy!" Another tweet read, "Lagta hai #IPLOpeningCeremony me Amy jackson ko kam pese diye the." Meanwhile, a user wrote, "Amy Jackson's dance was so pathetic, 28 dance teachers closed their academy forever and went to Kashi."

headlines: Sports Ministry appoints two foreign coaches in athletics
text: India's Sports Minister, Vijay Goel, approved the appointment of two foreign coaches in the discipline of athletics on Thursday. Goel said his ministry is committed to providing best possible help, sports infrastructure and equipment to athletes in their training for preparation and participation in international competitions. The appointments include a race walking and a 400-metre relay coach.

headlines: Viv Richards blames 'arrogant' West Indies board for decline
text: West Indies cricketing legend Viv Richards has called the West Indies' cricket board 'arrogant' and has blamed it for the decline in WI's cricket. West Indies have failed to qualify for June's Champions Trophy, where the top eight ODI sides will compete. The team is also at a risk of missing out on an automatic berth for World Cup 2019.

headlines: India will be permanent member of Security Council: Swaraj
text: External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj on Thursday expressed confidence that India would become a permanent member of the UN Security Council. Swaraj further said she expected that the new members would have the same rights, including the veto power, as the existing permanent members. "If not this time, then next time, India would become a permanent member," she added.

headlines: 31 killed, 40 injured in ISIS attack in Iraq's Tikrit
text: At least 31 people, including 14 police officers, were killed and 40 others were wounded on Tuesday in an attack by Islamic State militants in Iraq's Tikrit, according to reports. Adding that there were around 10 militants, including two suicide bombers, police officials said the militants had been wearing police uniforms and used a police vehicle to enter the city.

headlines: Rajya Sabha passes Goods and Services Tax Bill
text: The Rajya Sabha on Thursday passed the four legislations which will enable the rollout of Goods and Services Tax Bill by July 1. The four Bills are the Central GST Bill, the Integrated GST Bill, the Compensation Bill and the UT GST Bill. Notably, the GST regime would absorb central excise, service tax, and other local levies.

headlines: Aamir refuses Dangal release in Pak without National Anthem
text: Actor Aamir Khan has decided not to release 'Dangal' in Pakistan after scenes featuring the Indian flag and Indian national anthem were asked to be cut by their censor board, as per reports. Aamir reportedly found the two cuts surprising as he felt Dangal does not portray extreme patriotism. Earlier this year, Pakistan lifted the ban on screening Indian films.

headlines: Shia Board issues fatwa against cow slaughter, beef eating
text: The All India Shia Personal Law Board (AISPLB) has issued a fatwa against cow slaughter and consumption of beef. AISPLB member Maulana Yasoob Abbas said that the reason behind the fatwa is that the cow slaughter often triggered communal tension in the country. He added that the fatwa was issued after consulting Shia cleric from Iraq, Ayatollah Sheikh Basheer Najafi.

headlines: The highest library book fine paid is â¹22,000
text: The world's largest fine for an overdue library book is over â¹22,000 ($345.14), according to the Guinness World Records. The amount was paid by Emily Canellos-Simms from the United States, for poetry book 'Days and Deeds', which was checked out of Kewanee Public Library, Illinois in April 1955. The amount was calculated at two cents a day for 47 years.

headlines: World's highest altitude haircut was at 19,000 feet
text: The world's highest altitude haircut on land was at 19,341 feet (5,895 metres), at the summit of Mount Kilimanjaro, Tanzania, according to the Guinness World Records. The haircut, done by Maurice Fiorio from Canada, included several steps such as pre-cut, elevation, texturising and clean-up. The record was established in January 2015.

headlines: Lubricant startup's ad banned for being 'too gay'
text: A lubricant advertisement by Boy Butter has been banned from cable TV in Chicago, US. Eyal Feldman, who founded the company, claimed ComCast TV "did not think [Chicago] viewers could handle the level of gayness in [the] ad". He further said that it is a "sexist and homophobic double standard".

headlines: Malayalam director arrested for verbally abusing Kochi mayor
text: Malayalam director Jude Anthany Joseph has been arrested for challenging and verbally abusing the Kochi mayor Soumini Jain. Soumini said she filed a police complaint when Jude began abusing her after being denied permission to shoot in the city's recently-renovated Subhash Bose Park. The director was later released on bail.

headlines: Suffered from depression, had suicidal thoughts: Asha Parekh
text: Veteran actress Asha Parekh has revealed that after the death of her parents, she suffered from depression and had thought about committing suicide. She added, "It was a very bad phase for me. I was totally alone and had to manage everything alone." Asha further said that she had to take the help of doctors to get out of depression.

headlines: Fitness tracker alerts woman of life-threatening condition
text: An American woman's Fitbit fitness tracker recently helped save her life after she noticed it was registering an abnormal resting heart rate. The tracker displayed a resting heart rate of over 140 beats per minute, higher than her usual 60-70. This prompted the woman to dial for an ambulance, after which doctors found potentially fatal blood clots in her lungs.

headlines: Smart garage startup locks out customer over bad review
text: US-based startup Garadget recently blocked a customer from using its internet-connected device to open his garage after he left negative reviews online. Replying to the review, Garadget Founder Denis Grisak said, "The abusive language... demonstrates your poor impulse control... I'm not going to tolerate any tantrums." However, Garadget unblocked the device after being slammed by other users.

headlines: Cow vigilantes backed by BJP, alleges Digvijaya Singh
text: Congress General Secretary Digvijaya Singh on Thursday alleged the Bharatiya Janata Party was backing the cow vigilantes across the country. "An extortion going on in the name of cows. Akhlaq was lynched in Dadri. A man is killed in Alwar. Who has given you right in this regard? The people are being beaten and killed at several places," he added.

headlines: Development is key to improve lives of Jharkhand people: PM
text: Addressing the people of Jharkhand, PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said, "Development is the only key to improve lives... The government is committed to serve the tribal communities through development." Modi added, "Our government has taken a historic decision to develop waterways. It has taken the development of waterways as a challenge. The Varanasi to Haldia waterways will be developed."

headlines: Arvind Kejriwal is a '420', says Subramanian Swamy
text: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader Subramanian Swamy on Thursday termed Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal as a '420' (thief) and a cheat. "Kejriwal is a '420' and we don't have any hopes from him. So, there is no use of commenting on him," he added. This comes after Shunglu Committee's report on gross misuse of power by the AAP government.

headlines: Air India to tighten security after Sena threat on MP ban
text: Air India has decided to tighten security for its flights starting from Mumbai and Pune after Shiv Sena threatened to disrupt them. Shiv Sena MPs threatened that unless the ban on MP Ravindra Gaikwad is lifted, they âwonât allow the airlines to fly from Mumbai". Gaikwad has been banned by airlines after he beat up an Air India employee.

headlines: Home rental startup FastFox gets â¹30 cr in Series A funding
text: Gurugram-based home rental startup FastFox has raised â¹30 crore in Series A round of funding from Lightspeed India Partners, Blume Ventures, CyberAgent Ventures and others. Earlier in 2015, the startup had raised â¹6 crore in seed funding led by Lightspeed India Partners. FastFox was founded in November 2014 by IIT alumni Pallav Pandey and Mukul Bhati.

headlines: Snapdeal CEO summoned over non-payment of â¹25 lakh in dues
text: A Bengaluru court has reportedly summoned e-commerce startup Snapdeal parent Jasper Infotech, its CEO Kunal Bahl, and nine other executives over non-payment of dues worth â¹25 lakh. The case, filed by Dream Merchants, claims Snapdeal signed up for a three-year contract as a sponsor for six editions of Bangalore Fashion Week, but didn't pay the promised amount in January 2016.

headlines: 7,615 Indians lodged in foreign jails: Govt
text: As many as 7,615 Indian nationals are lodged in foreign jails, Minister of State for External Affairs VK Singh said in the Rajya Sabha on Thursday. Out of these, 1,810 Indians are lodged in Saudi Arabian jails, and 1,214 are in UAE prisons, he added. There are an estimated 1.16 crore non-resident Indians settled globally, he further said.

headlines: â¹2 lakh withdrawal limit won't apply to banks, post offices
text: Ban on cash transactions in excess of â¹2 lakh will not be applicable to withdrawals from banks and post office savings accounts, the Income Tax department has said. Through the Finance Act 2017, the government had banned cash transactions of over â¹2 lakh, adding that a penalty of an equal amount would be levied.

headlines: Being an actor or acting was never my dream: Parineeti
text: Parineeti Chopra has said that being an actor or acting was never her dream. However, she added, "But I knew I was living my dream when my first film released, and I saw thousands of people go out there, watch my films, love me and then mob me on the road." Parineeti made her debut in 'Ladies vs Ricky Bahl'.

headlines: Chris Martin meets fan with cancer before his concert
text: Singer Chris Martin met Ken, a fan suffering from stage IV cancer before performing at a concert in Philippines. Ken could not attend the band's concert owing to his medical condition. The concert's organiser came to know about him after his brother wrote a post on Facebook, in which he said Ken had purchased a ticket for the concert.

headlines: Deepika Padukone shares childhood picture with her sister
text: Actress Deepika Padukone took to Instagram to share a childhood picture of herself with sister Anisha Padukone. In the picture, Deepika can be seen wearing a blue-and-white striped collared T-shirt with blue jeans, while her sister is dressed in a red top and white pants. Notably, Anisha, who is 26-years-old, is a professional golfer.

headlines: Messi dedicates goal in Sevilla match to cancer-struck kids
text: Barcelona forward Lionel Messi dedicated his goal against Sevilla in the La Liga on Wednesday to cancer-struck children through a new celebration. Messi pointed two fingers to his right cheek, referring to a two-fingered mark which represents a cancer movement in Spain called Para los valientes (For The Brave). Messi is helping raise funds for a cancer hospital in Barcelona.

headlines: Indian chess player suspended in Dubai for alleged cheating
text: Jeel Shah, a 21-year-old Indian chess player, was suspended from the Dubai Open Chess Tournament on Wednesday for alleged cheating. Jeel was playing another Indian in a match when he was taken aside for "suspicious behaviour" and frisked by the arbiter. A mobile phone was reportedly found with the player, which the organisers alleged he used to cheat.

headlines: Keeping bad for my back: AB de Villiers
text: South African cricketer AB de Villiers has said that he will not return to assume wicketkeeping duties for the teams he plays for as it will affect his health negatively. "I'll miss the next five years if I start keeping again. My back won't allow that," De Villiers said about the prospect of wicketkeeping again.

headlines: Apes can separate true and false beliefs in others: Study
text: A study reveals apes have understanding at par with human infants in distinguishing whether a person has an accurate belief about a situation or is mistaken. Experimenters locked certain objects in a box beside an empty box in front of apes. With a person trying to locate the objects, apes pointed the right box 76.5% of time, showing human-like understanding.

headlines: Designer slammed for 'fat shaming' Amy Schumer
text: Swimsuit designer Dana Duggan has been slammed for 'fat shaming' Amy Schumer over her InStyle magazine cover. "You're part of the problem," commented a user. Another comment read, "Swimwear is not just for women who are a size 2!". Duggan said she was simply exercising her right to freedom of speech and reportedly stated that Amy looked 'like a pig'.nnn

headlines: India jumps 31 places to attain best FIFA ranking in 20 yrs
text: The Indian football team jumped 31 places to reach the 101st rank, its best in 20 years, in the latest FIFA rankings released on Thursday. India, ranked 11th in Asia, have won 11 of their last 13 matches, scoring 31 goals. India posted a 1-0 victory over Myanmar recently, after registering a 3-2 win over Cambodia in a friendly.

headlines: PV Sindhu rises to career-best world no 2 ranking
text: India's Rio Olympics silver medal-winning shuttler, PV Sindhu jumped three spots to reach her career-best ranking of world number two in the women's singles rankings on Thursday. Sindhu, who recently defeated Rio Olympics gold winner Spain's Carolina Marin to win the India Open title, is 12,152 points behind the 22-year-old top-ranked Taiwanese shuttler Tai Tzu Ying.

headlines: How does Google Maps track traffic?
text: Google Maps uses the location services function on devices to track the coordinates of a place. It combines real-time data from all enabled devices to determine the number of cars on roads and predict the trip time. Google has also compiled information to create traffic histories and uses it to determine whether traffic is running slower or faster than usual.

headlines: Fire can be created using ice
text: Experiments show that clear ice, shaped in the form of a disk, can be used to create fire. After impurities are removed from an ice slab, it can be melted and smoothed by using the heat of hands. When the piece is held perpendicular to the Sun, the concentration of sunlight on a particular spot results in creation of fire.

headlines: We are friends, we meet regularly: Raveena on Twinkle
text: Raveena Tandon, while talking about Twinkle Khanna, said, "We are friends and we all know each other in the industry, we all meet each other regularly." Earlier, Twinkle joked how she almost dropped social entrepreneur Arunachalam Muruganantham's biopic as her first production venture because he thought she looked like Raveena. Twinkle's husband Akshay Kumar and Raveena dated in the 90s.

headlines: Boeing, JetBlue back Indian-origin man's aircraft startup
text: Hybrid electric aircraft startup Zunum Aero, founded by Indian-origin entrepreneur Ashish Kumar, has received investments from aerospace companies Boeing and JetBlue. The startup intends to make regional aircrafts with space for 10 to 50 passengers for flights up to 1,600 km. "Our goal is to be part of a disruptive force rather than the one being disrupted," said JetBlue.

headlines: Those who disagree with Modi have no place in India: Rahul
text: Congress Vice President Rahul Gandhi on Thursday condemned the recent Alwar lynching and said that those who don't agree with PM Narendra Modi and the RSS have no place in the country. "This is the new vision of India which Prime Minister Narendra Modi is propagating. It's a vision where only one idea will prevail," Gandhi added.

headlines: Photosynthesis grew by 30% over 200 years: Study
text: US-based researchers have estimated that net plant photosynthesis on Earth grew by 30% over the 200-year record they captured. The research did not identify the cause of the increased photosynthesis but suggested rising CO2 levels, longer growing seasons, and nitrogen pollution as probable reasons. However, emissions from fossil fuel burning overwhelm the CO2 uptake by plants, researchers said.

headlines: New Zealand PM's spaghetti pizza sparks online debate
text: New Zealand Prime Minister Bill English has sparked a debate after cooking pizzas with tinned spaghetti and pineapples for his family of eight.
