Users posted, "I might vote Labour now" and "Would you serve this stuff to your international guests??" However, another said, "If you had 6 kids canned spaghetti would be the height of gourmet cooking for you too!"

headlines: Emma Stone receives 'La La Land' inspired prom proposal
text: A high-school student from US posted a video on Twitter, asking Emma Stone to be his prom date with a 'La La Land' parody video. He filmed the video in the style of the opening song from the film, which features a dance number on a traffic-filled Los Angeles highway. The student said he re-wrote the lyrics to the song.

headlines: Turtle with 2 heads, 6 legs found in China
text: A turtle with two heads and six legs has been found in China. The baby red-eared slider, which was unknowingly purchased by a pet store owner, can reportedly move and eat like its counterparts. Further, all its eyes blink and legs move. Meanwhile, researchers said the anomaly was "caused by genetic mutation, just like a human."

headlines: Nivea removes âwhite is purityâ ad after claims of racism
text: Skincare brand Nivea has pulled an ad declaring âwhite is purityâ after social media users protested its racist connotations, while others used it to spread messages of white supremacy. Nivea further sent an apology, saying the post was not meant to be offensive. The ad, for a deodorant by the company, was meant to target users in the Middle East.

headlines: Saumya Tandon to quit Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai! serial: Report
text: Television actress Saumya Tandon is reportedly planning to quit television serial 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai!' to focus on other projects. Shilpa Shinde, who earlier played 'Angoori bhabhi' in the show, had claimed that Saumya had not taken her sexual harassment allegations against producer Binaifer Kohli's husband Sanjay seriously. Shilpa added that Saumya said, "No one rapes in our industry."

headlines: Can learn money-making from brothers like Rajinikanth: Kamal
text: Actor Kamal Haasan has said that he can learn the art of money-making and filmmaking from his brothers like Rajinikanth. Kamal said this at the memorial meeting of his late elder brother Chandra Hasan. Rajinikanth, who also attended the meeting, said that Chandra helped Kamal save money, and added that he was worried how Kamal will handle his finances now.nn

headlines: Shabana Azmi shares pic of herself travelling in Delhi Metro
text: Actress Shabana Azmi took to Twitter to share a picture of herself travelling in the Delhi Metro. "Travelling by Delhi Metro from airport to make it in time for an urgent appointment! It's SUPERB...clean!," read the caption alongside the picture. After her appointment, Shabana tweeted that she wouldn't have made it on time if she were travelling by car.

headlines: Mayweather shouts at judges after daughter loses competition
text: Former American boxer Floyd Mayweather lost his temper at judges officiating at a cheerleading event where Mayweather's daughter was a participant. Mayweather claimed that the judges cheated, which caused his daughter's team to lose and finish second at the youth cheerleading competition. Mayweather also reportedly mentioned that he funded the competition.

headlines: Jayaram beats world no. 2 to reach Malaysia Open quarters
text: Indian shuttler Ajay Jayaram defeated the world number two shuttler Denmark's Viktor Axelsen with a 9-21, 21-14, 21-19 scoreline to book a place in the quarterfinal round at the Malaysia Open Superseries Premier on Thursday. With the win, Jayaram, who is the world number 20 currently, registered his third victory over Axelsen in a total of five matches.

headlines: Misbah-ul-Haq announces retirement from Test cricket
text: Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq has announced he will retire from Test cricket after the completion of upcoming Test series against West Indies. The 42-year-old said he will continue to play cricket at domestic level alongside other cricket activities. Misbah, who was made captain in 2010, guided Pakistan to achieve the number one spot in ICC Test rankings for the first time.

headlines: AB de Villiers launches his own mobile app
text: South African cricketer AB de Villiers launched his own mobile app 'AB 17' on Thursday. Available on both Android and iOS, the app enables fans to interact with the cricketer, besides giving them updates. It has been developed in collaboration with a US-based company and makes ABD the first South African sportsperson to have a personalised fan engagement application.

headlines: Mayweather gifts 16-year-old son Mercedes-Benz on birthday
text: Retired boxer Floyd Mayweather Jr threw a birthday party and gifted his son, Zion, a Mercedes-Benz car on the latter's 16th birthday. Zion posted pictures from the party on his Instagram account, which showed American rapper Young Thug performing at the party. Zion and his friends flung around fake dollar bills, with the party having bottle service and dancers.

headlines: Leander Paes dropped from India vs Uzbekistan Davis Cup tie
text: Indian tennis star Leander Paes has been dropped from the Indian squad for the Davis Cup tie against Uzbekistan, which will be held in Bengaluru from April 7 to April 9. Indian doubles player Rohan Bopanna has been picked ahead of the 43-year-old. India are facing Uzbekistan in the second round clash in Group 1 of the Asia/Oceania zone.

headlines: Messi beats 3 defenders to set up SuÃ¡rez's bicycle kick
text: Barcelona forward Luis SuÃ¡rez scored with a bicycle kick, assisted by Lionel Messi running from the half-line, to score the opening goal against Sevilla at Camp Nou on Wednesday. In the 25th minute, Messi sprinted down the right flank outrunning three defenders and providing a deflected cross to SuÃ¡rez in the box, who finished with an overhead kick.

headlines: 'Museum of Failure' to open in Sweden
text: A new museum celebrating retail failures is set to open in the Swedish town of Helsingborg this summer. The 'Museum of Failure' will celebrate ideas that failed to translate into consumer hits, including a Harley Davidson cologne and a Twitter Peek mobile device created only for tweeting. The other items include Coca-Cola's coffee-flavoured soft drink 'Coca-Cola BlÄK'.

headlines: Tail strikes of world's deadliest scorpion studied 1st time
text: Portuguese scientists have studied for the first time the tail attacks of the 'death stalker', regarded as the most poisonous scorpion in the world. The researchers compared defensive tail strikes of various scorpions using a high-speed camera and then created 3D-models on a computer. It was revealed that different strike trajectories depend on the tail shape of the venomous arachnids.

headlines: Lindsay Lohan spotted in burkini at a beach in Thailand
text: Actress Lindsay Lohan was spotted at a beach in Phuket, Thailand wearing a 'burkini', which is a full-body swimsuit. She was seen paddleboarding at the beach. The burkini is from her upcoming fashion line, reports said. In March, she had posted a photo of herself on social media wearing an embroidered headscarf with the caption, "New Fashion Line coming soon".

headlines: Sex has not been normalised even today: Hugh Hefner's son
text: Founder of Playboy magazine Hugh Hefner's son Cooper has said he does not think sex has been normalised even today. "The fact that it is available on the internet and behind closed doors does not mean... we have adopted a comfortability... on the topic," he added. Cooper further said women still face trouble when it comes to owning their sexuality.

headlines: Over 40,000 phone numbers made public by Bengaluru Police
text: Bengaluru Police has been posting the phone numbers of the complainants calling the emergency number 100 since April 2015 on its Twitter account, making over 40,000 phone numbers public. The Twitter account was closed for public view only on Wednesday. "It's obvious the accused will know who registered the complaint and privacy doesn't matter here," said a senior police official.

headlines: Paytm may buy FreeCharge at 50% discount for $200 mn: Report
text: Digital wallet Paytm may buy SoftBank-backed rival FreeCharge at a 50% discount for as low as $200 million, according to reports. FreeCharge was acquired by Snapdeal in 2015 at an estimated $400 million. This comes amid reports of SoftBank looking to sell Snapdeal to Flipkart and dropping Paytm as a Snapdeal bidder over lower valuation offered.

headlines: Smoking causes one in ten deaths globally: Study
text: According to a US-based study, 11.5% of deaths around the world in 2015 were caused due to smoking. The researchers found there were around 6.4 million deaths attributed to smoking, half of which were in four populous countries namely China, India, USA, and Russia. The study mentions there were nearly one billion smokers in 2015, 933 million being daily smokers.

headlines: ISIS executes 33 in Syria in largest mass killing of 2017
text: The ISIS executed 33 people in Syria's al-Mayadeen desert on Wednesday in its "largest execution operation" of 2017 so far, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said. The monitoring group added that the victims, aged 18 to 25, were "killed by sharp tools." ISIS also opened fire on policemen and civilians in Iraq on the same day, leaving 22 dead.

headlines: Military action against N Korea on the table: US
text: US President Donald Trump on Thursday told Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe over a phone call that "all options are on the table," including military action, to counter the threat from North Korean missiles. The US will continue to strengthen its ability to deter and defend itself and its allies with the full range of its military capabilities, Trump added.

headlines: World's only floating national park is in India
text: The Keibul Lamjao National Park, located in the Loktak Lake in Manipur, India, is known as the only floating national park in the world. The area is characterised by 'phumdis', a Manipuri word referring to floating mats of soil and vegetation. Among numerous animal species, the park is home to the brow-antlered deer, which is locally known as the 'Sangai'.

headlines: Sheep can see behind themselves without turning their heads
text: Sheep have large rectangular pupils, which provide them with a peripheral and a panoramic vision ranging approximately 270Âº. This allows them to even see behind themselves without turning their heads. While the structure of their eyes is similar to humans, their vision span is about 100Âº more as compared to human beings.

headlines: I have been hearing for 22 years that my career is over: SRK
text: Actor Shah Rukh Khan said that he has been hearing for 22 years that his career in Bollywood is over. He added, "Everyone keeps saying it...(but) there will be a film which will do badly, and there are so many...which have done so well, too." Shah Rukh further said that his main aim is to entertain people during a film.

headlines: Comedian Sunil Pal requests Sunil Grover to forgive Kapil
text: Comedian Sunil Pal has shared a video on Facebook in which he has requested Sunil Grover to forgive Kapil Sharma. "You and Kapil have made the show a success and you two are the wheel of the show," he said. Pal added, "Nearly 500 people are employed because of Kapil's show. Please consider this and come back on the show".

headlines: Friends actor David features in video on sexual harassment
text: David Schwimmer, known for portraying Ross Geller in American sitcom 'Friends', has featured in a video titled 'The Boss'. The video is a part of #ThatsHarassment campaign which includes six videos depicting sexual harassment based on true stories. "Every woman in my family...has been harassed. The problem is people don't step forward or say something about it," said Schwimmer.

headlines: Physicists find new approach to solve $1 mn maths problem
text: Physicists have proposed a new way to solve the 'Riemann Hypothesis' regarded as "the greatest unsolved problem in mathematics", proving which carries a $1 million (â¹6.5 crore) cash prize. The hypothesis predicts prime number distribution, which is used for designing encryption codes, below any given threshold. The physicists propose using quantum mechanics to solve the 158-year-old problem.

headlines: Kohli meets BCCI panel to negotiate pay hike for players
text: Virat Kohli, along with coach Anil Kumble and a few members of the Indian cricket team, met BCCI's Committee of Administrators members Vinod Rai and Vikram Limaye to negotiate a salary hike for the players. Rai later said "any issue pertaining to players' interest will be addressed with utmost seriousness", and Kumble would make a presentation regarding the demand.

headlines: â¹19,500 pillow that tracks sleep and lights up to wake made
text: US-based startup Mode Modern has created a â¹19,500 smart pillow that tracks the users' sleep and wakes them up by creating lighting effect similar to the rising Sun. It has built-in speakers that play any selected music from the pillow's dedicated app. The pillow also records voices while the user is asleep so that sleep disruptions can be traced easily.

headlines: China's Tencent passes Wells Fargo as 10th biggest firm
text: Chinese Internet firm Tencent Holding has overtaken US banking major Wells Fargo by market capitalisation to become the world's 10th biggest publicly traded company, according to Bloomberg. Tencent gained 1.6% on Wednesday, valuing the company at $279 billion. With this, six of the top 10 companies by market value are now technology firms, including all of the top four.

headlines: Apple sued for refusing to fix iPhones disabled by bug
text: Australia's consumer watchdog has sued Apple for not fixing iPhones disabled by an 'Error 53' glitch. The bug, for which Apple apologised in 2016, bricked iPhones if the home button had been repaired by third parties. However, the lawsuit accuses Apple of knowingly disabling phones and then refusing to unlock them as the devices had been serviced by non-Apple repairers.

headlines: Revoke ban on Gaikwad, else we won't let airlines fly: Sena
text: Shiv Sena MPs have said in the Parliament that they will not let any aircraft fly from Mumbai if the airlines do not revoke their ban on Ravindra Gaikwad. "If you want to diffuse the situation, we can do it. If you want to aggravate it...do that. But aircraft safety won't be compromised," Civil Aviation Minister Ashok Gajapathi Raju said.

headlines: Delhi journalist critical after being attacked in park
text: Journalist Aparna Kalra (45) was attacked by an unidentified man in a public park while she was on an evening walk on Wednesday. Kalra is critical and is undergoing treatment at Fortis Hospital, where she was admitted with multiple brain injuries. With no eyewitnesses or traces of theft, the police have registered a case of attempt to murder.

headlines: EU holding UK hostage like mafia: Former UKIP leader Farage
text: Former UKIP leader Nigel Farage on Wednesday accused the European Union of behaving like the mafia by holding Britain hostage to ransom with "vindictive" demands in the Brexit negotiations. However, he retracted his comments and branded the MEPs as "gangsters" instead after the European Parliament President Antonio Tajani called his comments unacceptable.

headlines: Nazi nerve gas used in Syria's chemical attack: US
text: The US government believes that the chemical agent Sarin was used in the chemical attack in Syria on Tuesday which killed at least 100 and injured over 400 people, according to reports. Sarin, which is an extremely deadly and fast-acting chemical agent, was first developed by Nazi scientists in 1938 and was banned in 1993 under international law.

headlines: Chemical attack in Syria changed my view of Assad: Trump
text: US President Donald Trump has said that the chemical attack in Syria that killed at least 100 people and wounded another 400, has changed his attitude towards Syria and its President Bashar al-Assad "very much". Adding that the attack had a big impact on him, Trump said that the heinous actions by the Assad regime cannot be tolerated.

headlines: Japan accepts same-sex couple as foster parents for 1st time
text: The city of Osaka has officially recognised a same-sex couple as foster parents, becoming the first Japanese city to do so, government officials said on Wednesday. A teenage boy has been living under their care since February. They had to undergo lectures, training, scrutiny and a screening by the city's social welfare panel before they were certified.  nn

headlines: 'Lettuce' work together: Police on â¹21 lakh lettuce theft
text: Canadian Police tweeted a picture saying, "'Lettuce' work together again," after a large truck containing lettuce worth C$45,000 (over â¹21 lakh) was stolen. The police also asked the public to "romaine calm" after the incident. Romaine is a variety of lettuce, and following the post, a person tweeted, "i'll romaine on the lookout."

headlines: Canadian couple wins lottery for the third time
text: A Canadian couple has won the lottery for the third time, splitting a C$16.3 million (around â¹78 crore) jackpot with another ticket holder. The couple, Douglas and Barbara Fink, had previously won the lottery in 1989 and 2010. The couple, whose recent jackpot was the largest, plan to spend their winnings on their family, a new house and travelling.

headlines: Infosys board has let down Founders: Ex-CFO Balakrishnan
text: Former Infosys CFO V Balakrishnan has said, âThe present Infosysâ Board has let down its founders and lost credibility to continue." "Its members should be replaced with new people,â he added. Further, backing Co-founder Narayana Murthy's opposition to pay hike of COO UB Pravin Rao, Balakrishnan said the present Board had lost moral courage by favouring executives and ignoring employees.

headlines: Tragedies happen when govt allows lynch mobs to rule: Rahul
text: Following the "brutal and senseless attack" by cow vigilantes in Rajasthan's Alwar, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday attacked the state government over the "shocking breakdown" of law and order. "When government...allows lynch mobs to rule, tragedies of immense proportion happen," Gandhi added. He said that he hoped that the government would take stern action against those responsible.

headlines: CBI books former Haryana CM Hooda in land allotment case
text: The CBI has booked former Haryana Chief Minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda for alleged re-allotment of a plot to Associated Journals Limited in Panchkula in 2005. He has been charged with criminal conspiracy, criminal breach of trust, and misuse of official position. A corruption case in this regard had been filed by the state Vigilance Department in May 2016.

headlines: LKâAdvani, 12 others conspired to demolish Babri Masjid: CBI
text: BJP leader LK Advani and 12 others were part of a larger conspiracy to demolish the disputed Babri Masjid, the Central Bureau of Investigation told the Supreme Court on Thursday. The accused include senior BJP leaders Murli Manohar Joshi, Uma Bharti, Kalyan Singh and Vishwa Hindu Parishad members. The CBI wants the trial to be held in a Lucknow court.

headlines: Investing in Mutual Funds can start at just â¹500 a month
text: Contrary to the belief that large sums must be invested in Mutual Funds to earn meaningful returns, people can start investing as little as â¹500 per month and gradually increasing the investment as income rises. For example, by investing â¹500 a month for 20 years at an annual return rate of 6%, investors can make â¹2.32 lakh at maturity.

headlines: 'Queen' director Vikas accused of sexual harassment: Reports
text: As per reports, Vikas Bahl, director of 2014 film 'Queen', has been accused of sexual harassment by a female employee at Phantom Films. She has claimed that Bahl misbehaved with her in Goa a few months back. According to company sources, Bahl has "behaved badly in the past" and a committee has been set up to investigate the employee's complaint.

headlines: Govt to set up Rail Development Authority to fix train fares
text: The Union Cabinet has approved setting up an independent regulator Rail Development Authority (RDA), that will recommend passenger fares for Indian Railways. Likely to be functional by August with an initial corpus of â¹50 crore, RDA will decide on tariffs, services for passengers and adoption of new technologies. The Railways Ministry will take final call on passenger and freight fares.

headlines: Madhya Pradesh govt to start diploma course for priesthood
text: The Madhya Pradesh government will start a one-year diploma course on Hindu priesthood called 'Purohityamâ from July this year. There will be no specifications on caste as both Scheduled Caste and Brahmins will be eligible for the course. The basic qualification required by a person to apply for the course will be senior secondary.

headlines: How was the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) formed?
text: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) was formed on April 6, 1980 with former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee as the first party President. Earlier Bharatiya Jana Sangh (BJS), founded by Syama Prasad Mookerjee, had merged itself into the Janata Party in 1977. However, due to internal differences in Janata Party, the Janata government collapsed, and BJP became a separate party.

headlines: 1st Modern Olympics winners got olive branch, not gold medal
text: There were no gold medals at the first-ever Modern Olympics, which started on April 6, 1896, in Athens, Greece. Winners were awarded silver medals and an olive branch, while second-placed athletes got a copper medal and a branch of laurel. One side of the medal had the face of Greek God Zeus, while the other side had the Acropolis.

headlines: Spain accused of Gibraltar traffic jams amid Brexit tensions
text: Gibraltar, a British overseas territory bordering Spain, on Wednesday accused Spain of causing long traffic jams by tightening border controls. Tensions between the UK and Spain have risen during Brexit negotiations over Gibraltar's future. Gibraltar Deputy Chief Minister Joseph Garcia said, "Spain has used traffic jams as a political weapon," alleging it had deployed special forces at the border.

headlines: 'Queen' director Vikas denies sexual harassment allegations
text: Vikas Bahl, who directed 2014 film 'Queen', has denied sexual harassment allegations against him by a female employee at Phantom Films. He said, "She isn't my employee. Yes, I'm friends with her. I want to ask her if I crossed a line...and would like to apologise for it." Bahl added that his company has not received any sexual harassment complaint. nn

headlines: Fine to eat dead animals, not those slaughtered: Dalai Lama
text: Asserting that Buddhists were neither vegetarian nor non-vegetarian, the Dalai Lama on Wednesday said it was alright to have the meat of dead animals, but not those purposefully killed for meat. Most Buddhists are vegetarian as they believe it is wrong to slaughter any creature. Notably, Dalai Lama himself is reportedly non-vegetarian.

headlines: PM Modi lauds party workers on BJP's 37th foundation day
text: On the 37th foundation day of BJP, PM Narendra Modi on Thursday congratulated party workers and thanked people for their support. "Guided by the Mantra of Antyodaya, our efforts to serve India especially the poor & the marginalised continue with great vigour," he tweeted. Union Minister Venkaiah Naidu said BJP had become a common man's party from a nationalist one.

headlines: I apologise to Parliament, not to Air India staffer: Gaikwad
text: Shiv Sena MP Ravindra Gaikwad has said in the Lok Sabha, "I apologise to the Parliament if I have caused any hurt, but not to the Air India official." He further demanded that the ban on him by airlines be removed and said, "What crime have I committed? What is my offence that I'm put under media trial without probe?"

headlines: Attack on Muslim by gau rakshaks did not take place: Naqvi
text: Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi has said that the incident of lynching a Muslim man by 'gau rakshaks' over beef issue has not taken place, as reported by the media. "It is a very sensitive issue. From this, there should be no indication or message that we are supporting such incidents," he added.

headlines: Trump's economic policies phenomenal: Billionaire Agarwal
text: Group Chairman of Vedanta Resources and billionaire Anil Agarwal has said that the US President Donald Trump's economic policies are "phenomenal". "He himself is a businessman and the way he spoke about Modi's efforts to reduce the involvement of bureaucracy and red tapism... He himself is doing that," Agarwal said. "I believe that he will correct himself," Agarwal further added.

headlines: US responds to N Korean missile test in 23-word message
text: US State Secretary Rex Tillerson responded to North Korea's latest ballistic missile test by saying, "North Korea launched yet another intermediate range ballistic missile. The United States has spoken enough about North Korea. We have no further comment." Some experts considered it as the US' refusal to give attention to North Korea, while others believed it reflected a tough stance.

headlines: Stylist pens letter on 'shame' of repeating outfits
text: Celebrity stylist Ami Patel has penned an open letter addressing the 'shame' that comes with repeating an outfit. "I get taken aback when I read articles on how celebrities are accused of "copying" a look on the red carpet," she wrote. Patel further wrote people should not have "unreasonable insecurities" about repeating their outfits.

headlines: Pepsi drops Kendall Jenner starrer ad after facing criticism
text: Pepsi announced on Wednesday that it is dropping an advertisement featuring model Kendall Jenner after facing criticism for 'trivialising' political resistance. "Pepsi was trying to project a global message of unity... and understanding. Clearly we missed the mark, and we apologise," the Pepsico unit said in a statement. "We also apologise for putting Kendall Jenner in this position," it added.

headlines: Burglar who stole stuffed animals sentenced to jail
text: A British burglar who stole 18 stuffed animals worth about Â£100,000 (â¹81 lakh) has been sentenced to 21 months imprisonment, said the police on Wednesday. Meanwhile, Detective Constable Stuart Goss said, "Cataloguing and exhibiting the stolen items was a truly unique and memorable experience, and this is certainly an investigation which will stay with me for years to come."

headlines: New species 'Spiderman' worm-snails discovered in Florida
text: Scientists have announced the discovery of a new species of worm-snails in Florida, US, which "shoot out mucous web like Spiderman". The snails have a pair of tentacles down near the base of their body to shoot slime, scientists added. Microorganisms get stuck on the slimy web, and the snails pull the web using their mouth to grab their food.

headlines: English village celebrates birthday of 2-year-old pothole
text: The Plumtree village in England recently celebrated the birthday of a two-year-old pothole to draw attention to the matter. The Plumtree People account tweeted, "The #Plumtree potholes mark yet another birthday," sharing a picture of the pothole. Following this, the council tweeted, "I donât think 'Happy Birthday' would be appropriate in this case," adding that the matter would be inspected.

headlines: Katy Perry reveals she googles 'hot' pictures of herself
text: American singer Katy Perry, in a post on Instagram, has revealed that she googles 'hot' pictures of herself. She shared a photo of herself wearing a push-up bra and shorts from a magazine cover shoot. The photo showed that she had uploaded it from a Google search. "[W]as feeling insecure about my last two posts so...," she captioned the photo. n

headlines: 400 icebergs disrupt North Atlantic shipping lanes
text: Over 400 icebergs have drifted into the shipping lanes of the North Atlantic Ocean since last week, forcing vessels to take detours of hundreds of kilometres. The average for this time of year is 80. A US Coast Guard Commander said, "I've never seen anything like it in my decade of experience," while experts attributed it to strong counter-clockwise winds.

headlines: Tennis world no. 16 puts his BMW up for sale on Facebook
text: Australian tennis player and world number 16 Nick Kyrgios has put his car up for sale on Facebook. Kyrgios posted an advertisement of the BMW F80 on his account, which has over 2,50,000 followers, saying it was the first car he bought. A fan offered Australian $6,000 (â¹2.9 lakh) to which Kyrgios replied, "I'll send you the petrol tank lid."

headlines: Rahul Dravid misses felicitation at IPL opening ceremony
text: Former cricketer and India U-19 coach Rahul Dravid missed his felicitation ceremony held during the inauguration of IPL 10 in Hyderabad on Wednesday. Dravid reportedly failed to reach the venue on time since his flight from Delhi to Hyderabad got delayed. He was supposed to be felicitated by BCCI along with Sachin Tendulkar, Sourav Ganguly, VVS Laxman and Virender Sehwag.

headlines: 14-yr-old becomes fastest kid to cycle across Australia
text: Si-am Juntakereket, a British boy, has become the fastest child to cycle across Australia after completing the almost 4,500-kilometre-long journey from Sydney to Perth in just 29 days. Juntakereket, who began the journey as a 13-year-old, cycled around 160 kilometres a day and slept in a tent as he went. Notably, Juntakereket is raising funds for learning disability charities.

headlines: HP govt denotifies 16 State Highways post SC liquor sale ban
text: In order to circumvent the highway liquor ban, Himachal Pradesh government has denotified 16 State Highways as 'Major District Roads'. The Supreme Court has banned the sale of liquor within 500 metres of National and State Highways. Notably, several other states have also requested the Centre to denotify National Highways as State Highways, so they too may bypass the ban.

headlines: Hyderabad beat Bangalore in IPL 2017 opener
text: Defending champions Sunrisers Hyderabad on Wednesday defeated Royal Challengers Bangalore by 35 runs in the first match of IPL 2017. Yuvraj Singh's 27-ball 62 and Moises Henriques' 37-ball 52 helped Hyderabad reach 207/4 in their 20 overs. In reply, Bangalore were dismissed for 172 in 19.4 overs as Afghanistan leg-spinner Rashid Khan picked two wickets in his debut IPL match.

headlines: Beijing could interfere in Kashmir, warns Chinese media
text: The Chinese state-run media on Thursday warned that Beijing could interfere in "turbulent" Kashmir over Tibetan spiritual leader Dalai Lama's ongoing visit to Arunachal Pradesh. It called India's move to invite Lama "clumsy and rude". This comes after Beijing on Wednesday asked India to stop the Dalai Lama's visit immediately and summoned Indian ambassador VK Gokhale to lodge a protest.

headlines: InMobi 2nd Indian billion-dollar startup to turn profitable
text: Mobile advertising startup InMobi said it turned profitable in the year 2016, making it the second Indian billion-dollar startup to achieve the feat after Mu Sigma. InMobi says it has been profitable every month since June 2016 and its net profit was â¹42-65 crore in the October-December quarter. "We are no longer dependent on anyone," said InMobi CEO Naveen Tewari.

headlines: Bezos to sell $1bn Amazon stock a year for his space startup
text: Amazon's Founder and CEO Jeff Bezos said on Wednesday that he plans to sell $1 billion worth of Amazon stock every year to fund his aerospace startup Blue Origin. Bezos is currently the world's second-richest person with a net worth of over $78 billion. Bezos' aerospace startup is aiming to ready a capsule by 2018 to take tourists to space.

headlines: Cutting runs out Jadhav with full-toss direct boundary throw
text: Sunrisers Hyderabad player Ben Cutting ran out RCB's Kedhar Jadhav with a full-toss direct throw from the boundary during the opening match of the IPL on Wednesday. Jadhav went low on a Moises Henriques delivery to play a sweep shot towards long leg. Cutting collected the ball and hit the striker's end, knocking off the stumps from the deep.

headlines: Ashish Nehra completes 100 wickets in IPL, misses hat-trick
text: Sunrisers Hyderabad pacer Ashish Nehra completed 100 wickets in IPL, taking two wickets in two balls against Royal Challengers Bangalore in the opening match of IPL 10 in Hyderabad on Wednesday. He is the eighth bowler overall to accomplish the feat and the first left-arm bowler to do so. Nehra finished with figures of 2/42 in his stipulated four overs.

headlines: Kashmiri crickters detained for wearing Pak jersey in match
text: A group of Kashmiri local cricketers was detained on Wednesday after a video clip surfaced on social media, showing them wearing the Pakistani team's jersey with the neighbouring country's national anthem being played in the background. According to reports, the video was from a cricket match between two teams, one representing Pakistan and the other India.

headlines: Uber admits it found one Waymo document on employee's device
text: Uber has admitted that it found one of the documents Google spinoff Waymo alleges was stolen by a former employee, on his computer. However, Uber emphasised that the document was not found on Uber's computers, but on the employee's personal device. Waymo claims that the employee downloaded several confidential documents in June 2016, one month before resigning and joining Uber.

headlines: Twitter ads featuring Donald Trump appear in Tokyo trains
text: A set of Twitter advertisements featuring US President Donald Trump has appeared in train cars and metro stations across Japan's capital Tokyo. Twitter's Japan spokesman said the Trump advertisements are a part of a new brand campaign set to last for two weeks. The campaign's slogan is "There is a 'now' you do not know about".

headlines: For losers in elections, EVM means 'Every Vote Modi': Naidu
text: Amid controversy over Electronic Voting Machine (EVM) tampering in elections, Union Minister Venkaiah Naidu said the parties who lost in elections have added a new dimension to EVMs, where it means 'Every Vote Modi'. "You press any button, vote goes to Modi." Naidu jokingly remarked.  Further, he questioned if EVMs were manipulated, why didn't it happen in Punjab or Delhi.

headlines: Over 8,000 Uber, Lyft drivers fail background check in US
text: More than 8,000 drivers of ride-hailing startup Uber and Lyft have been denied licenses to operate in Massachusetts, US, under a new background check law. Hundreds of applicants were turned down because they had serious crimes on their record, including violent or sexual offenses. Others had drunk or reckless driving offenses, while 51 applications came from alleged sex offenders.

headlines: Shiv Sena MP Gaikwad reaches Delhi via chartered flight
text: Shiv Sena MP Ravindra Gaikwad, banned from flying by major airlines after he assaulted an Air India staffer, reportedly reached Delhi via a chartered flight on Wednesday. The flight is believed to have been provided by Shiv Sena MP Rajkumar Dhoot. Previously, SpiceJet, Air India and IndiGo had cancelled Gaikwad's tickets and he had travelled to Delhi by road.

headlines: LS passes bill for â¹1L compensation in industrial mishaps
text: The Lok Sabha on Wednesday passed the amendments suggested by the Rajya Sabha in the Employees Compensation Bill. The bill provides for a compensation between â¹50,000-â¹1 lakh for employees in case of an injury during an industrial accident. It also caters to occupational diseases and has a provision for a hefty penalty in case of violations by an employer.

headlines: Over 24,000 Indians still in 6 war-torn countries: Govt
text: There are 24,084 Indians currently residing in six war-torn countries, including Iraq, Syria, and Afghanistan, the government said on Wednesday. While approximately 11,000 Indians are still in Iraq, an estimated 8,000 are in Lebanon and nearly 3,000 are in Afghanistan, Minister of State for Foreign Affairs VK Singh said in a written reply in the Lok Sabha.

headlines: Protecting cows was spirit behind freedom movement: Minister
text: Defending the crackdown on illegal slaughter houses in Uttar Pradesh, Commerce Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Wednesday said cow protectionism was the "spirit" behind the country's freedom movement. Sitharaman said this while replying to a debate in the Lok Sabha over the issue of availability of animal skin for the leather industry in the wake of the ban on cow slaughter.

headlines: Andhra CM promises 100% LPG coverage by June 2
text: Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu has asked the officials to ensure that the entire state has 100% LPG coverage by June this year. The deadline set by the CM was June 2, which would be exactly three years after the state was bifurcated. Officials told Naidu there were roughly 28 lakh households that were yet to receive a connection.

headlines: Germany approves bill curbing hate crime on social media
text: Germany's Cabinet has approved a new bill on curbing hate comments and fake news on social media. The new rules would impose fines of up to â¬50 million (over â¹346 crore) on social networking sites that fail to swiftly remove illegal content. "Just like...streets, there is...no room for criminal incitement on social networks," German Justice Minister Heiko Maas said.

headlines: Missing boy who sparked police hunt found hiding under bed
text: A missing nine-year-old boy who sparked a three-hour police search was found hiding in a drawer compartment under his bed, UK Police has said. The police had mounted a river search and called for a helicopter, while neighbours also joined the search. The boy, Josh Dinning, later said he had not wanted to go to school.

headlines: It destroys you if your film doesn't release: Shoojit Sircar
text: Filmmaker Shoojit Sarkar, while talking about his never-released film 'Shoebite', said, "It destroys you if your film doesn't release...I can't tell you the pain." He said the legal battle over 'Shoebite' affected him and he shifted from Mumbai and now lives in Kolkata. He added. "No box-office collections can match seeing your film has released and people are enjoying it."

headlines: I'll go to jail if needed: Kamya on court order against film
text: Television actress Kamya Punjabi, while reacting to a show-cause notice by a sessions court for releasing short film on late actress Pratyusha Banerjee, said, "I am not scared and I will go to jail, if needed." Kamya added that she does not want to give more importance to Pratyusha's boyfriend Rahul Raj Singh, who sued Kamya for releasing the film.

headlines: 2 killed, 10 injured in lightning strike in Himachal
text: At least two persons were killed and 10 others were injured, including two police personnel, due to a lightning strike on Wednesday at Khadahan village in Himachal Pradesh. The incident took place when a police party along with some people had been entering a vehicle with the body of an unidentified person, the police said.

headlines: Govt approves MoU with Aus for cooperation in healthcare
text: The Union Cabinet chaired by PM Narendra Modi has approved a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between India and Australia on cooperation in the field of health and medicine. The main areas of cooperation include communicable diseases such as malaria and TB, regulation of pharmaceuticals, vaccines and medical devices, mental health and non-communicable diseases, tobacco control, among others.

headlines: Security personnel accused of raping minor in Chhatisgarh
text: Security personnel have been accused of raping a 14-year-old girl at a village in Maoist-affected Sukma, Chhattisgarh on Sunday, according to reports. The victim's father told the media that a group of security personnel came to his hut early that day, and attacked his family members. However, the girl and her family members are yet to register a complaint.

headlines: 'Not possible to copy all security features of new notes'
text: Minister of State for Home Affairs Kiren Rijiju on Wednesday said it was not possible for forgers to copy all security features of the new currency notes of â¹500 and â¹2,000 denominations. "Fake currency notes are of low quality. They use low quality paper and ink and can be easily identified," Rijiju told the Rajya Sabha.

headlines: Chelsea defeat Man City; Arsenal rout West Ham in PL
text: Chelsea registered a 2-1 win over Manchester City, while Arsenal cruised to a 3-0 win over West Ham in the Premier League on Wednesday. Eden Hazard scored twice for Chelsea to maintain their seven-point lead over Tottenham at the top of the table. Meanwhile, Arsenal rose to fifth place, with Mesut Ãzil scoring on his 150th appearance for the club.

headlines: Morata hat-trick, Messi brace fetch wins for Madrid, BarÃ§a
text: A hat-trick by Real Madrid forward Ãlvaro Morata and a brace by Barcelona's Lionel Messi fetched wins for the teams in their respective La Liga encounters on Wednesday. Real Madrid registered a 4-2 win over LeganÃ©s, as Morata became the first Spanish striker to score a hat-trick for Madrid in eight years. Messi scored twice as Barcelona defeated Sevilla 3-0.

headlines: Expats in India for over 182 days need Aadhaar for I-T
text: The government on Wednesday said expatriates would be required to apply for Aadhaar card if they are staying in India for over 182 days and are required to pay domestic income tax. Further, the Finance Act provides for mandatory quoting of Aadhaar for submitting income tax returns and for making an application for allotment of PAN effective July 2017.

headlines: Spice Girl Mel B accuses husband of abuse, forced threesomes
text: Melanie Brown (Mel B), member of former girl band Spice Girls, has filed a case against her estranged husband Stephen Belafonte, where she has alleged domestic abuse and forced threesomes. "(He) demanded that I participate in sexual intercourse with him and random women," stated Melanie in her  court documents. She has also filed for a restraining order against Stephen.

headlines: Trailer of 'I Am Heath Ledger' documentary film released
text: The trailer of documentary film 'I Am Heath Ledger' has been released. The documentary will feature rare and intimate footage of the late actor and revelations by his friends and family. The film will premiere on April 23 at the Tribeca Film Festival, and release in limited theatres on May 3. Notably, Ledger's 38th birth anniversary was observed on Tuesday.

headlines: Fake honesty is just for selling books or movies: Kajol
text: Kajol, while addressing her fallout with Karan Johar, said, "There's a lot of fake honesty... and actually, it's just for selling books... or movies." She added, "There are a lot of reasons for faking it in front of the camera." Kajol further said that if she reacts on the fallout with Johar, she'll ensure the world hears of it.

headlines: Zeenat Aman debuts in web series with Love Life & Screw Ups
text: Veteran actress Zeenat Aman is making her debut in web series by starring in 'Love Life & Screw Ups'. In the web series, Zeenat plays the character Joana, a spinster who loves to mingle with the youth. "We were looking for a glamorous actress with great comic timing and Zeenatji fit the bill perfectly," said the director Kapil Kaustubh Sharma.

headlines: Russia mulls banning children under 14 from social networks
text: Russian lawmakers have drafted a bill to bar children under 14 from using social media networks, according to reports. As per the draft, social network platforms will have to register new users only after they provide their passport data. Platforms violating this rule could be fined between 100,000 to 300,000 rubles (around â¹1.15-3.45 lakh).

headlines: Govt using 'mud therapy' to preserve Taj Mahal's colour
text: The government on Wednesday said a kind of mud therapy is being used on the Taj Mahal to preserve the colour of the white marble structure. This mud therapy involves an application of a paste of 'multani mitti', Culture Minister Mahesh Sharma said. Efforts are also being made to reduce the impact of insects on the 17th-century structure, he added.

headlines: Bihar village seeks to be renamed as 'Yogi Adityanath Gram'
text: A group of residents of Kelabari Fulwaria village in northeastern Bihar has resolved to have the village renamed as 'Yogi Adityanath Gram', after the UP Chief Minister. The proposal to change the name of the village was put forth in a meeting held on April 1, which was "approved" by a chorus of supporting voices.

headlines: No change in fee structure, word limit for RTI queries: Govt
text: The Centre has said that it is committed to easy and full implementation of the RTI after it faced criticism for the proposed amendments to the rules. "It has been alleged that the size of the RTI has been restricted to 500 words... But there is no change in fee structure or word limit in RTI," the government stated.

headlines: Narendra Modi made 56 foreign visits as Prime Minister
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has made 56 foreign visits since taking the office in May 2014, the government informed the Parliament on Wednesday. After first visiting Bhutan in June 2014, Modi visited the US four times, and Nepal, Japan, Russia, Afghanistan and China two times each, Minister of State for External Affairs VK Singh said.

headlines: Trump removes his chief strategist from top US security body
text: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday removed White House Chief Strategist Steve Bannon from his National Security Council (NSC) role. Bannon had been elevated to NSC's principals committee at the beginning of Trump's presidency. Bannon's addition to NSC had sparked concerns from Trump critics, who said it was inappropriate for the political adviser to be involved in national security matters.

headlines: New Malaysian law does not criminalise child marriages
text: Malaysia has passed a law that offers stronger legal protections for children against sexual offenses but stops short of criminalising child marriages. Responding to a proposal to ban child marriages, a Malaysian MP said girls as young as nine are "physically and spiritually" ready for marriage. Under civil law and Islamic law, girls and boys under 18 can be married.

headlines: Trump blames Syrian chemical attack on Obama govt
text: Talking about Tuesday's chemical attack in Syria in which 100 people were killed and 400 were injured, US President Donald Trump said the attack was a result of the "weakness" of the previous Barack Obama-led administration. "President Obama said in 2012 that he would establish a 'red line' against the use of chemical weapons and then did nothing," Trump claimed.

headlines: US court extends civil rights protections to LGBT workers
text: A US Federal Court has extended civil rights protections to LGBT employees under the Civil Rights Act of 1964. The court ruled that the Act, which prohibits discrimination based on "color, sex or national origin", also covers discrimination based on sexual orientation. The lawsuit was filed by an employee, who accused the employer of firing her based on sexual orientation.

headlines: Rape victims should marry their rapists: Malaysian MP
text: Rape victims should marry their rapists as it would allow them to not face a "bleak future", Malaysian MP and former sharia judge Datuk Shabudin Yahaya said during a debate over a bill on sexual offenses against children. "She will have a husband, at least, and this could serve as a remedy to growing social problems," Yahaya added.

headlines: Meningitis epidemic kills 336 children in Nigeria
text: A meningitis epidemic has killed 336 children in Nigeria amid fears it could spread across the border to Niger, international health officials said. Around 3,000 cases have been reported in northwest and north-central Nigeria after the disease surfaced in December. Notably, meningitis killed over 1,000 people and infected more than 10,000 in Nigeria and Niger in 2015.

headlines: Ranbir, Deepika to feature together in an ad: Report
text: As per reports, Ranbir Kapoor and Deepika Padukone are set to feature together in a smartphone advertisement. While Deepika has already been made the brand ambassador for the smartphone, Ranbir has been approached for endorsing the mobile phone brand. Deepika and Ranbir started dating in 2008 but reportedly broke up in 2009.

headlines: KL Rahul, Murali Vijay watch United's PL match
text: Indian cricketers KL Rahul and Murali Vijay visited the Old Trafford to watch Manchester United's Premier League match against Everton on Tuesday. Rahul's Instagram post, which featured him alongside a few trophies, read, "To do list : 1.watch a game at old Trafford, 2.watch zlatan playing live, 3.watch zlatan score a goal."

headlines: Split in SP complete, will never return: Amar Singh
text: Stating that the split in the Samajwadi Party was now complete, expelled leader Amar Singh on Wednesday said he will never return to the party. "Once I was expelled by the father (Mulayam Singh Yadav) and then by the son (Akhilesh Yadav)...I would prefer sitting at home than going back to them," Singh added.

headlines: Himachal CM seeks ballot paper-based Assembly elections
text: Himachal Pradesh CM Virbhadra Singh on Wednesday called for using ballot paper-based voting in Assembly elections to be held later this year. "I used to think that these machines were fool-proof and tamper-proof, but with recent incidents, it can be seen that they can be manipulated," he added. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal also demanded the use of ballot papers.

headlines: Shiv Sena MPs threaten protest over Air India ban on Gaikwad
text: Shiv Sena MPs on Wednesday threatened to disrupt Parliament proceedings if no action was taken against Air India for banning the party's lawmaker from Osmanabad Ravindra Gaikwad from flying on its planes. Gaikwad had last month assaulted a 60-year-old Air India Duty Manager with his slipper. Following this, Air India and four other airlines had barred Gaikwad from their flights.

headlines: Tree trunks emit greenhouse gas instead of storing it: Study
text: US-based researchers tested a cluster of trees, soil and woody debris to determine whether those three components were sources or sinks of greenhouse gases. Tree trunks were found to emit methane rather than storing it, scientists said, which could counteract absorption of methane by forest soils. However, the mechanism of methane production in forests was not clearly understood.

headlines: Sugarcane genetically modified to give biodiesel, more sugar
text: Researchers have genetically engineered sugarcane plants to produce oil in its leaves and stem for biodiesel production. It was found that modified sugarcane also produced more sugar, which could be used for ethanol production. Sugarcane with 5% oil would produce an extra 465 litres of biodiesel per acre than soybeans and 1325 more litres of ethanol per acre than corn.

headlines: Don't do private practice: Adityanath tells doctors
text: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday asked doctors in the state to talk to their patients politely and not indulge in private practice. "If a doctor talks to his patient politely, half the ailment disappears," Yogi said. "Don't try to earn money, try to earn blessings of the people as well," he added.

headlines: IIT-BHU student sets self on fire, jumps from hostel balcony
text: A student at IIT (BHU) in Varanasi allegedly committed suicide by jumping from the balcony of his hostel room after setting himself on fire on Tuesday night, police said. The student, Dara J Bhim Raju, was a second-year BTech student pursuing a course in Mining Engineering. The cops said the initial probe revealed he was reportedly upset over his grades.

headlines: Odisha 6-yr-old saves friend from crocodile using a stick
text: Tiki Dalai, a six-year-old girl from Odisha on Tuesday saved her schoolmate from a crocodile with the help of a bamboo stick. The girl picked up the stick and hit it on the crocodile's head when it leaped from the water and attacked her friend. The victim sustained multiple wounds but is said to be out of danger.

headlines: 7 killed, 10 injured in Somalia car bomb explosion
text: At least seven people were killed and 10 were wounded on Wednesday after a car bomb exploded near the Somali Ministry of Internal Security in Mogadishu, officials said. No one has claimed responsibility for the attack. However, militant group al-Shabaab, which has been forced out of the country, had threatened a "vicious war" against Somalia's new government earlier.

headlines: Choice of food is right to life, says Allahabad High Court
text: The Allahabad High Court on Wednesday observed that food, food habits and vending of food are intrinsically linked to the right to life and livelihood guaranteed under the Constitution. It further gave the UP government 10 days to draw up a plan so that its crackdown on illegal slaughterhouses and meat shops does not deprive people of livelihood or food.

headlines: IPL 10 kicks off in Hyderabad; SRH take on RCB in opener
text: The tenth edition of the Indian Premier League kicked off on Wednesday, with defending champions Sunrisers Hyderabad taking on Royal Challengers Bangalore in an encore of the last year's final at Hyderabad. BCCI felicitated former cricketers Sachin Tendulkar, Virender Sehwag, VVS Laxman and Sourav Ganguly at the opening ceremony. Bollywood actress Amy Jackson also performed on the occasion.

headlines: Govt rejects Pak's claim on Gilgit-Baltistan as its province
text: External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj on Wednesday rejected Pakistan's move to declare Gilgit-Baltistan as its fifth province, saying it is totally unacceptable. "One should not doubt the intention and policies of the NDA government with regard to J&K," she added. Earlier, British Parliament also said that the region is a constitutional part of J&K illegally occupied by Pakistan since 1947.

headlines: Shia Le Beouf's film earns only â¹567 in first weekend in UK
text: The Shia LeBeouf starrer 'Man Down', which released on March 31, has earned only Â£7 (â¹567 approximately) in its opening weekend in UK. The film was only shown in one cinema hall before being given a Video on Demand release. Senior media analyst Paul Dergarabedian wrote, "Poor Shia... That opening could be in the Guinness World Records or something."

headlines: Facebook announces tools to tackle 'revenge porn'
text: Social media platform Facebook on Wednesday said it was launching tools to make it easier for users to report "revenge porn", or when intimate photos of people are shared without consent. Facebook also said its new photo-matching will automatically prevent images from being shared again once they have been banned. Accounts of people who share revenge porn may be disabled.

headlines: Stone-pelting youth fighting for nation: Ex-J&K CM Farooq
text: National Conference President and former Jammu and Kashmir CM Farooq Abdullah on Wednesday defended stone-pelting youth, saying that they are fighting for the nation. "If he (stone-pelting youth) is giving up his life, he is not doing it for tourism. He is giving his life so that the destiny of this nation is decided which should be acceptable," he said.

headlines: Congress alleges Arun Jaitley misled Parliament over Lokpal
text: The Congress party on Wednesday moved a privilege notice against Finance Minister Arun Jaitley, for allegedly misleading the Parliament over the appointment of anti-corruption watchdog Lokpal. Congress' KC Venugopal said Jaitley misled the house by saying that the Lokpal Bill was pending with the standing committee when President Pranab Mukherjee has already given his approval to the bill.

headlines: Bengaluru jail violating rules for Sasikala: Reports
text: The Bengaluru jail is reportedly violating its rules for Sasikala Natarajan, who is serving a four-year term in a disproportionate assets case, by allowing her to meet visitors beyond 5 pm. As per reports, Sasikala has seen 27 visits by various people in the 31 days she has been lodged in the jail, which is also against prison manual.

headlines: Ghaziabad councillor held for morphed Adityanath image on FB
text: A municipal councillor from Loni has been arrested by Ghaziabad police for allegedly posting a morphed photograph of newly-elected Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on his Facebook timeline. A complaint was lodged against Ramkumar Chauhan by a member of the Hindu Yuva Vahini, an organisation founded by Adityanath. The alleged inappropriate post on Facebook was deleted.

headlines: Rajasthan announces reward on 'gau rakshaks' who lynched man
text: The Rajasthan Police has announced a reward of â¹5,000 for anybody providing information on each of the six suspected 'gau rakshaks' who lynched a 55-year-old man to death. All the identified accused have been booked for murder, the police said. The deceased and four others were attacked when they were transporting cattle along the Alwar highway on Saturday.

headlines: Over 52 thefts reported daily in Delhi Metro this year: Govt
text: Union Minister of State for Home Hansraj Gangaram Ahir on Wednesday said that over 52 thefts have been reported every day in the Delhi Metro this year so far. While 3,854 theft cases have been reported in the Delhi Metro till March 15 this year, a total of 9,705 theft cases were reported in 2016 and 3,104 in 2015.

headlines: White House calls Pulitzer Prize winner a 'left-wing blog'
text: White House spokesperson Sean Spicer called Pulitzer Prize-winner journalism site ProPublica a "left-wing blog" and dismissed its report on changes made to a trust document allowing President Donald Trump to withdraw money from his businesses without disclosing it. In response, ProPublica delivered a 15-tweet thread defending its reporting and shared the revised document.

headlines: F-16 fighter jet crashes near Washington DC
text: An F-16 fighter jet has crashed two miles south of Joint Base Andrews, near Washington DC, according to reports. The pilot on board the aircraft reportedly ejected and was picked up by a military helicopter before being taken to the hospital. There have been no reports of injuries and homes in the area have been evacuated, reports added.

headlines: 100 cities organise pillow fights to help homeless kids
text: Over 100 cities around the world recently hosted public pillow fights to collect donations for the needy, including shelters for homeless children. People also dressed up in different costumes for the International Pillow Fight Day held on April 1. The event was held in cities including New York, Amsterdam, Bengaluru, London and Budapest.

headlines: Airtel promoter pays â¹2 lakh to settle insider trading case
text: Bharti Airtel's promoter firm Indian Continent Investment has settled an alleged insider trading case by paying â¹2.17 lakh towards settlement charges to SEBI. The company, which bought Airtel shares between 2007 to 2010, saw its holding cross 5% in April 2008, requiring it to make necessary disclosures. However, it was alleged the promoter company failed to make such disclosures.

headlines: RBI appoints Malvika Sinha as new Executive Director
text: The Reserve Bank of India has appointed Malvika Sinha as Executive Director (ED), who took charge on April 3, 2017. As Executive Director, Sinha will look after Foreign Exchange Department, Department of Government and Bank Accounts and Internal Debt Management Department. Notably, Sinha holds a master's degree from University of Bombay and has done her master's in Public Administration.

headlines: Make 'My Name is Khanna' and cast me: Twinkle to Johar
text: Actress-author Twinkle Khanna suggested her friend filmmaker Karan Johar to cast her in a sequel to his 2010 film My Name is Khan and add two alphabets to name the new film 'My Name is Khanna'. Her response was prompted by Johar's tweet showing appreciation for Twinkle's acting skills in a recent smartphone advertisement.

headlines: Farhan, Aditya get into a verbal spat over Shraddha: Report
text: As per reports, Farhan Akhtar and Aditya Roy Kapur got into a verbal spat as Farhan got upset over Aditya bonding with Shraddha Kapoor at a recent event. Shraddha is said to have gone to Farhan's residence to sort out the issue. While Farhan is reportedly dating Shraddha currently, Aditya is rumoured to be her ex-boyfriend.

headlines: Salman Khan pens foreword for Asha Parekh's autobiography
text: Actor Salman Khan has penned a foreword for veteran actress Asha Parekh's autobiography. He has started the foreword by writing, "They don't make them like her anymore". Salman has further written about Asha Parekh's journey and her choice of films over the years. The book will be unveiled by Salman this week in Mumbai.

headlines: Man dies trying to eat doughnut in 80 seconds in challenge
text: A 42-year-old from United States, Travis Malouff, reportedly choked to death on Sunday, trying to eat a doughnut in 80 seconds as part of a doughnut shop's eating challenge. A witness stated that people tried to help him when they realised he was choking but were unsuccessful. Reports later revealed that Malouff died "due to obstruction of the airway".

headlines: Indian ODI team retains fourth spot in ICC ODI team rankings
text: The Indian ODI team has retained its fourth spot in the ICC ODI team rankings despite not playing the 50-over format for over two months. The Virat Kohli-led Indian team has 112 rating points, one point behind New Zealand. South Africa lead the chart with 119 rating points followed by Australia with 118.

headlines: Rashid Khan becomes 1st Afghan player to feature in IPL
text: Spinner Rashid Khan became the first cricketer from Afghanistan to play in an Indian Premier League match, after featuring for the Sunrisers Hyderabad against the Royal Challengers Bangalore in the season opener on Wednesday. The 18-year-old leg-spinner had said, "I am looking forward to working closely with Muttiah Muralitharan as it is going to help me a lot."

headlines: Firm ordered to pay â¹55 crore for selling video game cheats
text: A US court has ordered developer Bossland to pay â¹55 crore to the company behind popular video games like World of Warcraft and Overwatch, for selling apps that let users cheat. The tools included ability to see other players' positions, health scores and other information from a distance within games. However, Bossland's website is still advertising cheats for several games.

headlines: Hacker magazine offers â¹6.5L for Donald Trump's tax returns
text: Hacker magazine '2600' has reinstated a bounty of â¹6.5 lakh for submission of complete federal tax returns of US President Donald Trump to seek "truth and accountability". However, 2600 added that it is "not an appeal for people to hack the IRS." Founded in 1984, the magazine was named after the frequency that gave hackers ability to control landline phones.

headlines: Indian Railways to redevelop 400 major stations
text: Indian Railways plans to redevelop about 400 'A-1' and 'A' category stations with private participation, Railways Minister Suresh Prabhu has said. These stations are generally located in major cities and are important tourist destinations. Prabhu said the cost of redevelopment will be met by leveraging the commercial development of spare railway land/air space in and around the station.

headlines: Islamic State used Mosul museum as tax department
text: After capturing Mosul in 2014, the militant group Islamic State destroyed its museum and turned it into their tax department. This was revealed after envelopes used to issue orders to pay Islamic tax, one of the main sources of funding for the militants, were found in the museum's basement. Iraqi troops took the museum back from the militants last month.

headlines: US man convicted of raping girlfriend over last cigarette
text: A man from Rhode Island, US has been convicted of repeatedly raping his then-girlfriend after he became angry that she smoked their last cigarette. A Superior Court jury convicted the man of four counts of first-degree sexual assault for the April 2014 attack. Prosecutors said the man violently assaulted the woman, who fled the apartment wearing only a bed sheet.

headlines: Jayalalithaa will not be declared a convict in DA case: SC
text: The Supreme Court on Wednesday ruled that former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Jayalalithaa will not be declared a convict in the disproportionate assets case. The court dismissed Karnataka government's review petition seeking to declare the deceased AIADMK leader a convict and recover a â¹100-crore fine by selling her properties. Earlier, the court had convicted AIADMK leader Sasikala in the case.

headlines: Chinese billionaire lost $3.1 billion in less than 90 mins
text: The billionaire Chairman of a Chinese dairy company, Yang Kai, lost $3.1 billion in less than 90 minutes when his company's stock fell recently. The value of Yangâs stake in the company fell to $530 million from $3.6 billion. While the reason for the fall in stock is unclear, his company's disclosures from lenders show heavy reliance on debt.

headlines: 11-yr-old accidentally makes â¹4.8 lakh online game purchases
text: An 11-year-old from the UK unintentionally made online game purchases worth about â¹4.8 lakh after accessing his parents' iTunes account on his iPad. The boy's mother said that he generally asks before making small purchases but on seeing an available â¹8,000 purchase, he grew curious and pressed multiple times. However, Apple has agreed to refund the amount to the family.

headlines: Will entertain with dignity, money isn't only reason: Sunil
text: Actor-comedian Sunil Grover has tweeted that for him, money can't be the only reason to do something, or not to do something. "My intentions are to act and to entertain with dignity," he added. His comments come at a time when he is said to have left The Kapil Sharma Show along with Asghar Ali, Chandan Prabhakar and Sugandha Mishra.

headlines: Stand-up comedian Biswa writes Facebook post against suicide
text: Stand-up comedian Biswa Kalyan Rath wrote a Facebook post on suicide and failure. Biswa wrote, "I don't feel like a failure and I am happy with my life." He said this is despite how he did not manage to get campus placement even though IITs having a near 100% placement rate and how he was depressed for some years.

headlines: Yeh Half Girlfriend kya hota hain, asks Arjun in new promo
text: Actor Arjun Kapoor has featured in a new promo for his upcoming film 'Half Girlfriend', where he asks the question, "Yeh Half Girlfriend kya hota hain?" Based on the novel of the same name written by Chetan Bhagat, the film stars Arjun as the character 'Madhav Jha' while Shraddha Kapoor portrays 'Riya Somani'. The film will release on May 19.

headlines: Harsha Bhogle to be part of IPL 2017's Hindi commentary team
text: Harsha Bhogle has announced on Facebook that he will be part of the Hindi commentary panel for broadcasters SET Max during IPL 2017. "It will be a new experience doing commentary in Hindi. I've done it before but only a little bit here and there...You will have to pardon (or be amused by) the Hyderabadi intonation and accent!" Bhogle stated.

headlines: New York's Eleven Madison Park named world's best restaurant
text: Eleven Madison Park in New York has topped the 'World's 50 Best Restaurants' list, which debuted in 2002. 'Osteria Francescana' in Italy and 'El Celler de Can Roca' in Spain were ranked second and third respectively. The list was prepared by a panel of over 1,000 chefs, food writers and other experts from 26 geographical regions.

headlines: Uber driver carrying loaded gun, fake police badge arrested
text: An Uber driver in the US has been arrested for impersonating a police officer and carrying a concealed weapon. The police said they found a fake police badge, a stolen license plate, and a pistol with loaded magazines in the vehicle. The driver is also accused of driving with a siren and telling passengers about "killing people and chasing murderers."

headlines: No plans to demonetise â¹2,000 notes: Govt
text: Minister of State for Home Kiren Rijiju has said in the Rajya Sabha that the government has no plans to demonetise the new â¹2,000 currency notes as was stated in several reports. Stating that the fake currency has mostly been seized from Gujarat and West Bengal, he added, "It is not correct that fake currencies cannot be identified."

headlines: Puma sues Forever 21 for copying shoe designs
text: Puma has sued retail fashion label Forever 21 accusing the company of copying a number of the Fenty X Rihanna designs created by singer Rihanna. Puma is demanding the retailer to stop selling the alleged rip-offs of Puma's fur slides, bow slides and creepers. It has also demanded that Forever 21 hand over all profits it has made from them.nn

headlines: Indian has record for heaviest weight held with eyelid
text: Satyajit Hota from India holds the Guinness World Record for the heaviest weight held with the eyelid at 3.51 kilograms. The record was established on the sets of 'Rekorlar Dunyasi' in Istanbul, Turkey, in June 2013. He earlier established the record with 3.40 kilograms in Italy in March 2012.

headlines: Boot house made of recycled material is up for rent in Texas
text: A house shaped like a boot, which is mostly made up of recycled material, is up for rent in Texas, United States, for about â¹78,000 a month. The house, built by artist Dan Phillips, is 35-foot-tall and includes two bedrooms, one bathroom and a rooftop deck. The entire structure reportedly took about a year and a half to complete.

headlines: Rabbit track and field competition held in Czech Republic
text: A rabbit track and field competition was recently held as part of a hunting exhibition about 60 kilometres from Prague in Czech Republic. About 100 rabbits took part in the competition, which featured various events such as long jump and high jump. It further included a 'running on a flat track' event.

headlines: Nasscom appoints Quatrro's Raman Roy as Chairman
text: IT industry body Nasscom on Wednesday appointed Quatrro CMD Raman Roy as its Chairman for 2017-18. Roy, who will assume the position from April 6, takes over from CP Gurnani, CEO of Tech Mahindra. Further, Nasscom has also named Rishad Premji, Wipro Chief Strategy Officer and son of Azim Premji, as its Vice Chairman.

headlines: Reliance Jio could earn â¹21,300 crore this fiscal: Moody's
text: Reliance Jio will be able to generate revenue of about â¹21,300 crore for the current financial year, assuming its 7.2 crore Prime users pay for services between July 2017 and March 2018, ratings agency Moody's said. Further, Jio's paid customers are "credit positive" for Reliance Industries, it noted. Jio's aggressive stance will ensure heightened competition in the sector, it added.

headlines: Customers to boycott SBI over new transaction charges
text: Following SBI's new rules, including charges on certain transactions, effective April 1, some customers have taken to social media to call for a "no transaction day" on April 6. They are calling for protests from April 24-April 26, if the bank does not remove the charges. Customers of six banks that merged with SBI also have to follow the rules.

headlines: SBI stock jumps to 25-month high on merger with 5 associates
text: Shares of State Bank of India, India's largest lender, closed at a 25-month high on Wednesday, gaining for the ninth straight trading session. The surge came after SBI merged its five associate banks and Bharatiya Mahila Bank on April 1. With the merger, SBI has joined the league of top 50 banks globally in terms of assets.

headlines: Suniel Shetty to host reality TV show India's Asli Champion
text: Actor Suniel Shetty is set to host the upcoming reality television show 'India's Asli Champion...Hai Dum!'  Talking about the show, the 55-year-old actor said, "It will test the contestants' will power to go that extra mile when their physical strength gives up." The show is scheduled to premiere soon on the channel '&TV'.

headlines: Rajkummar Rao to work with John Abraham in upcoming film
text: Actor Rajkummar Rao will work with John Abraham in an upcoming film which is tentatively titled 'Chor Nikal Ke Bhaaga'. John will reportedly play the role of a policeman in the film, which will be directed by Amar Kaushik. The film will also feature Tamannaah Bhatia as an air hostess, reports added.

headlines: High school junior takes his 93-year-old grandmother to prom
text: Connor Campbell, a high school student from US took his 93-year-old grandmother to his school dance. She got her makeup and hair done by her daughter for the occasion and said dancing with Connor was the best part of the evening. "I won't go next year. I want him to find a girlfriend," she said with a laugh.

headlines: Yuvraj, Dhawan, Warner play indoor cricket due to rain
text: Players of the Indian Premier League side Sunrisers Hyderabad including Yuvraj Singh, Shikhar Dhawan and captain David Warner played cricket with a tennis ball indoors due to rain in Hyderabad. David Warner chose to bowl while Dhawan batted before former Indian pacer Javagal Srinath bowled to Yuvraj at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium.

headlines: Footballer slips while taking corner, gives handball foul
text: Scottish footballer Charlie Adam slipped while taking a corner kick for his team Stoke City and touched the ball, resulting in a handball foul for Burnley in Premier League on Tuesday. Adam slipped before knocking the ball with his knee and then collected it to retake the corner, which was not allowed by the referee.

headlines: Ex-F1 champ disqualified from Ironman triathlon for speeding
text: Formula One driver and former champion Jenson Button was disqualified from an Ironman triathlon for overspeeding during the cycling section. Button, participating in the Ironman 70.3 in California, finished third but was later stripped off his title when he went over the speed limit in a cycling section where riders are supposed to be slow for safety reasons.

headlines: Woman spends 13 hrs in wet clothes as flight bars loo access
text: An 87-year-old woman, Kocharik Tsamouzian, sat in wet clothes for 13 hours after British Airways cabin crew refused to let her use the toilet, during her journey from Los Angeles to London in December. The flight was delayed on the runway for 90 minutes, during which she was not granted access to the toilet, and ended up wetting her clothes.n

headlines: Dutch men hold hands in protest against LGBTQ violence
text: Dutch men are holding hands in an act of protest and solidarity after a gay couple was beaten for holding hands in public. The couple was holding hands in Arnhem, Netherlands, when they were attacked by a group on Sunday morning. "Hand in hand with gay people and shoulder to shoulder against discrimination," wrote a person on Twitter.

headlines: Pepsi faces flak for new ad featuring Kendall Jenner
text: Pepsi has been criticised for 'trivialising' political resistance over a new advertisement which shows Kendall Jenner using a beverage can as a peace offering to police during a protest. "[T]his...ad is disgusting why would you make money out of protest," read a tweet. Another user commented, "[I]f a cop tries to beat or kill you hand them a Pepsi asap!"

headlines: Dalai Lama's visit seriously damaged ties with India: China
text: China on Wednesday said that Dalai Lama's visit to the "disputed" part of the eastern part of China-India border caused serious damage to China's interests and China-India relations. It added that the country will lodge a diplomatic protest to India. However, India has maintained that China should not interfere in India's internal matters.

headlines: Sensex, Nifty close at record high
text: The benchmark indices BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty ended at record closing highs on Wednesday ahead of the Reserve Bank of India's monetary policy statement due on Thursday. The Sensex breached the 30,000-mark during intraday trade before closing at 29,974. Further, Nifty also touched a fresh lifetime high of 9,274 during the day.

headlines: Does money get locked up by investing in Mutual Funds?
text: On investing in Mutual Funds, the money is managed by professional fund managers and is not locked up. Mutual Funds ensure flexibility to redeem the investment either partially or entirely. Additionally, investors can also give standing instructions to the Mutual Funds company to transfer a fixed amount into their bank account on a specified date of every month or quarter.

headlines: Kohli named Wisden's Leading Cricketer in the World for 2016
text: Virat Kohli has been named as the Leading Cricketer in the World for 2016, in this year's edition of the Wisden Cricketer's Almanack. Kohli becomes the third Indian to be bestowed with the honour, with Virender Sehwag winning it twice in 2008 and 2009, and Sachin Tendulkar in 2010. Kohli had the highest average in all three formats last year.

headlines: eBay Founder commits $100mn fund for investigative reporting
text: E-commerce major eBay's Founder Pierre Omidyar's charity firm announced a $100 million commitment to support investigative reporting on Wednesday. The first $4.5 million will go to International Consortium of Investigative Journalists, which led the Panama Papers investigation. "A free media is key to providing trusted information and critical checks on those in positions of power," said Omidyar.

headlines: There is a double-decker living root bridge in Meghalaya
text: There is a double-decker living root bridge in Cherrapunji, Meghalaya, which is believed to be the only one of its kind in the world. Numerous other living root bridges are spread across the Khasi Hills region. These bridges are known to have been built by the Khasi community, over 100 years ago, by tending roots to form a bridge.

headlines: Cricket scene in Kashmir wins Photo of the Year award
text: A picture of a boys' cricket game in Srinagar's Mughal Gardens by Indian photojournalist Saqib Majeed has won Wisden's Cricket Photo of the Year award for 2016. The photo was chosen from over 450 entries, out of which 11 were shortlisted. Virat Kohli was the most featured cricketer in the entries, with a picture of him being among the awardees.

headlines: Russia seeks India's EVM technology for 2018 polls: Report
text: While the Opposition in India has raised doubts over the reliability of EVMs, Russia has sought India's EVM technology for 2018 presidential elections, a report has claimed. During the Uttarakhand Assembly polls, Deputy Chairman of the Russian Election Commission, Nikolai Levichev, had visited the state to closely monitor the functioning of EVMs and the electioneering process.

headlines: Cap-like device fights brain tumours with electric pulse
text: A cap-like device that fights brain tumours using electric fields has been found to improve survival rates for cancer patients, according to a study on 695 patients. The two-year survival rate increased from 30% to 43% for patients using the device along with chemotherapy versus those treated with chemo alone. The treatment costs $700 (about â¹45,000) per day.

headlines: 30-mn-year-old fossil holds oldest mammal blood ever found
text: US-based researchers have discovered the oldest known fossilised mammal red blood cells preserved in amber.
